I love this product and am so glad I got it for a recent cruise! I could bet this across my body, and it was easy to access and carry all my necessary paperwork in! It helps a passport, money, room key and even some lip balm!
Looks like just what I need for our trip to Europe.  The only thing I could be critical of is the size.....it seems large and could have been a tad smaller, other than that, looks good.
The tickets need to be folded to fit within. Good buy and was very useful though, carried it round the world and back. Must have if you are visiting crowded countries!!!

I purchased this because I went on a mission trip to the Ukraine and was told to keep my money and passport around my neck or waist at all times.  My passport fit perfectly in one of the zippered compartments and all my money fit perfectly in the velcro part.  I was also told to order perfect money and not to fold or wrinkle it.  Well, it fit perfectly without having to fold it and it stayed perfect.  It fit nicely under my tops and was comfortable.  Since it's not plastic, it didn't itch or bother me.  Would buy it again in a heart beat!
It was better than I expected--Lots of room for a cell phone--  I like all the other zippered pockets also.  I would definitely recommend this for traveling
The item arrived actually earlier than expected!  It is lightweight which is perfect and just what we wanted.  Plenty of room for passport, ID, and other things.  I am very happy with this purchase.

This neck stash is comfortable and holds everything just perfectly! Passport, ID, money, extra memory cards and batteries for my camera all fit perfectly. Adjustable neck strap works great! Love this product!!!
This items works really well and fits great. Would recommend it to anyone. Conceals easily and comfortable to wear.  Great product.
I like the item, but the bottom seam started coming apart before I had it 2 weeks.I like the fact I could use it and not the big purse all the time, but the stitching could have beenmuch better.

I used this to hold my passport, boarding passes, money and cards while traveling in Europe.  It is lightweight, adjustable, sturdy and comfortable.  I carried the pouch under my shirt and it was comfortable enough that I was mostly unaware of it.It has a divided pouch with a velcro seal, ideal for passports and boarding passes.  It also has 2 separate zippered compartments for holding other items like cash, credit cards or whatever.  The neck cord seems firmly attached.  It is very long and adjustable with a little spring loaded device.I was very pleased with this and will use it again on future trips.
Horrible musty smell to product that would not go away even after washing it and fell apart...stay away from purchasing.

There's nothing special here, but this is what I expected.  It's very light weight, and I suspect it wouldn't hold up to much abuse, but hard to beat the price.  My only real complaint is that the zipper pockets are only barely big enough for my passport, so it takes more concentration than I'd prefer to use them for passport storage.

Dont leave home without this product when you are traveling. I have been to 15 countries and I have heard people tell horror stories of stolen wallets in every country. There are pro's out there who make a living by stealing your wallet or purse. I always make sure my money and passport are in this pouch around my neck and I have never had a problem. Heading to Italy next week with my pouch around my neck.

This thing is far too big and bulky to wear under a t-shirt. I guess I could've figured out the approximate size, but there should be measurements in the listing.I ended up putting it around my waist and sticking it into the top of my pants. That worked well enough.You might want to go ahead and cut that little tag off as soon as you get it, because it will flip up and keep the velcro from closing completely.
All your travel docs in one place.  No more fumbling for Tickets, Id's and passports.Does what its supposed to do.  Keep everything in one place and all secured aroundyour neck.

I got this as a gift for my sister who is going to be working Bangladesh and she needed a pouch like this! She absolutely loved it and is very happy with it. Not only does it nicely hold her important documents but it holds the new Kindle she got or Christmas too. She loves it, I am happy that it turned out to be a great deal and gift. Awesome!
Used this pack for a trip to Europe. It's slim and holds a decent amount of stuff. Very handy for passports/money/whatever you want to keep close to you at all times.
I researched various passport holders before selecting the Lewis N. Clark neck stash.  It was very economical and should prove very useful for my upcoming trip.

I used it on my recent trip to Rome where the tourist areas are known for pick pockets.Pickpocket rummage my pant's pocket on the subway but there's no money there.My money was in the neck bag under my shirt.

I am taking this to Italy.  Tried it out and it has two separate zipper pockets and two more pockets secured by a velcro strip.  Very flat and comfortable fabric either under my shirt or inside my jeans.  I gave it 4 stars because I don't care for the large string that would show on your neck.  Otherwise I think it is great!

This Lewis & Clark neckwallet is excellent.  Love the 4 separate compartments--2 zippered and 2 full length secured with velcro.  I bought this because my thick wallet was causing pain in my right hip from sitting on it.  I thought using a neckwallet instead might help, and it has.  Very comfey,great product

We've returned after a long trip to South America where we were pre-warned to keep all important documents safely stored. This neck pouch did just that. The size, design( adequate pocket/zippers) and quality provided my husband and I the security and peace of mind needed in all travel destinations.

Perfect for trip to Latin America, where it seems that some of the 10 Commandments (like shalt not STEAL) are no longer followed. This stash allowed me to carry my passport, cards, and cash around my neck easily and safely, and it is very comfortable. Stops the crime of opportunity. Great Item!I did find out that cash will trigger the TSA search. Went to private room for "private screening" where they looked through the stash. Found out it is easier to place ALL stashes/moneybelts in the carryon luggage as it goes through the scanner, then go to the rest room to put it all back on before flying.
It is lightweight and basic.  It is comfortable to wear.  I wish it has a zippered pocket somewhere for money.

Wore under clothes in Italy to carry passport, hotel information, and extra money.  Very lightweight and comfortable.  You forget that it is there.  Keep tucked in to top of jeans. Can adjust length easily.  Two zippered sides and a divided pouch in back.  Easily holds passport in a ziploc bag.  We traveled in cool weather, but have heard to put in bag so that perspiration does not dampen important papers/passport.  That was not an issue for us, but might be in hot weather.
My husband and I both used these and were very pleased.  They were comfortable and easy to retrieve.  The fact that we could "size' the neck was great!

I purchased this item because of tremendous reviews. Unfortunately, it is of EXTREMELY POOR QUALITY! While touring Westminster Abbey - after using this for less than 4 DAYS it ripped and all of my American money went falling to the floor!!!!! $300 - $400 was stolen before I could recover it!!! This is the poorest quality item and the worst experience I have ever had with any item I have ever purchased!!!
summary: DON'T BUY THIS ITEM!!!! LOST $300 TO $400 BECAUSE OF IT!!!!

reviewText: We ordered this for my 11-year-old granddaughter. It arrived quickly (thank goodness!) and is exactly what she needed! Having two zippered compartments and two pockets inside the velcro gives ample space for holding cash, debit cards, passport, and itinerary. It's lightweight enough to wear all day without feeling heavy. Great product!

This travel pouch was everything I had hoped for. It helped me to be organized with my travel documents. I didn't use it out on the streets. But, keeping my money, passport, etc. safe (and accessible at the same time) while moving through various airports was my main goal and it worked very well for me.
He needed this for a trip abroad.  It will work well to fit his passport, Ipod, small wallet and cash.
This neck stash fits under my clothes nicely. It is light and never irritates my skin nor is it bothersome around my neck.carries passport and monies.

Quality material, easy to wash and dry, lots of zipper areas and holds more paperwork and currency than you could imagine from seeing just pictures of it. Discreet and comfy to wear around neck for men or women.

Seems nice, it is big enough for my passport and medical papers. It seems that the back material may make me sweat, but otherwise the item should work for me.  I have yet to use it, but my old one was a cheapie that wasn't perfect but worked for decades, so this one should be an ok replacement
It became bulky and difficult to use.  I had to carry a wallet anyway as it was tough to access from under my shirt.  I ended up leaving it locked in the hotel safe.

My husband used this for our trip to Europe and it definitely gave us a peace of mind. However, this is not really breathable so if you sweat the contents will be damp. Need to keep this in mind when traveling during summer.

I haven't used this yet, but I purchased it for my next trip. I already have a waist wallet, but I can't get to it without going to a restroom and partially undressing. This seemed much simpler to use.
Gave me peace of mind traveling in Europe considering a travel companion was nearly pick-pocketed in Barcelona.  Seemed to be more functional and comfortable than traditional money belt.
I really like this. I ordered several different ones but this one is really convenient for the documents I want to carry close and safe where I can get to them easily,

I bought this for an overseas trip so I could carry my passport and some cash right next to my body.  Well darn, I started dropping coins every once in a while and could not figure out why.  A very close inspection found that the fabric on the bottom of one section had pulled away from the stitching.  Only one compartment had failed but it made me concerned about when the rest would drop out.  This after less than a week of wear is just plain wrong.  I should have heeded the other reviewers.

I bought this for our Disneyland trip. I used it for the tickets, 2 cards and some cash. I noticed in the middle of the day that the bottom had ripped its stitches. Good thing I did not lose my credit card and ID. My opinion, don't expect too much.
summary: Good for a day's use only

reviewText: I had two strokes and only have limited use of one hand. This bag can hang around your neck or the arm of your wheelchair and allows easy and secure access to your money or papers.  I would recommend it to anyone needing easy access.  It has two separate pockets accessible by zipper or a Velcro flap.
I just received two of this item today. It appears that the quality of the zippers is very poor and one of the zipper has been broken and can't close at all. I don't recommend it to anyone.
No complaints, this travel pouch worked great on our 2 week Europe trip.  I would recommend it.  Product is exactly as described.
Just what I needed.  It was the perfect size to wear under my clothes and it had all the room that was needed to carry all of my documents and money.

The Deluxe Neck Stash is slim, light, and non-irritating.  An excellent product!My book, THE ROAD TO MAGDALENA, by Lawrence Hall, is also available from amazon.com.  A good value in paper, and even better on Kindle - usually free!  But then, I can't autograph your Kindle, can I?
summary: Carry Your Passport and Your Cash Next to Your Heart

reviewText: like the product but started to fall apart towards the end of our trip.stronger fabric would be nicer and better seaming.

What makes this a 'Deluxe' Neck Stash is the additional number of pockets and zippers. (I also bought the 'non-deluxe' LNC Neck Stash for daily use around town and on road trips.)  http://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B00004SR8W/ref=cm_cr_ryp_prd_ttl_sol_2I don't much care for zippers or Velcro:  I like one-handed stuff.  That said, this is probably the one I'll carry through airports BECAUSE of the zippers, Velcro and the need for two hands to get at 'some' stuff.  passport card, boarding pass, business cards are secure in the zippered pockets.  The smart phone's ok in one of the open pockets.  No need to risk losing an entire wallet:  that can stay in the carry-on.
summary: Nice if you can live with zippers.

reviewText: We like them because of their size , not too bulky , they should be unobtrusive under our clothing !
Daughter said it worked well and held up through six weeks of student travel through Germany, France, England, Scotland, and other parts of Europe.

The neck stash is soft and comfortable.  The zippers for the two separate secure pockets work fine.  The neck strap seems sufficiently strong and is adjustable.  The Velcro closure is perfect.  I like the beige color.  The price is reasonable.
summary: It does what it is advertised to do.  I lilke it.

reviewText: Overall seems Ok. Haven't used it on an overseas trip yet as I intended. For the price, size and individual storage pockets, I would recommend it.

I used it for 1 full day and two half days and the side I had my cash came undone and if my husband would not have noticed it my cash would have fallen out.  (It already started--that's why he noticed.)  So the sewing is shoddy.

I bought this based on other recommendations for an overnight trip to the city and it proved invaluable.  It was comfortable to wear and I liked knowing my license, credit cards, and cash were secure.  It also seems well made.  Great value!

I have used thsi pouch amost continuously( many times sleeping with the pouch on ) for the last three months.  For me, it is comfortable to wear to the point I do not feel its present except the weight of its content.  There were some complaints from reviewers regarding the zippers for this pouch but I have not found any issues so far on my pouch.  Very good functional neck pouch at an affordable price.  Please note that this pouch is not RFID.  There is a very similar Lewis & Clark RFID pouch avaiable for those who would prefer a RFID one.
summary: Very good and affordable neck pouch

reviewText: I purchased this before going abroad.  It's quite small, I was able to fit my passport, my credit card, and some cash in it.  I usually used the 'shoving down the pants' technique if I was in a sketchy area.  It shows if you try to use the under the shirt technique.  It's a good little purse, and I haven't gotten robbed yet.  The little zipper pulls stick to the velcro though, and the cord is beginning to fray.  It's a cheapie, but it works.
summary: Getting robbed in a foreign country, not cool.

reviewText: I bought this for my trip to Japan and was very happy with having my hands free.  But, my husband is disabled and uses a walker to get around so his hands are occupied.  This little pouch was exactly the thing he needed to carry his cell phone and wallet in.  He has literally worn out one and we're on the second one.  We've been very happy!
This is very lightweight and small enough not to be cumbersome.  Will hold passport etc.  The long strap can be shortened.

The product has several pockets for various items and is well made. The product is approximately 1" wider than my passport, substantially taller than unfolded american currency, and created a large pattern showing from under my clothing. The adjustable neck band allowed me to adjust the location from chest high to under my belt. No matter where I placed the item, I could not find a comfortable place and it always showed through my clothing like an advertisement even with only a small amount of currency with no passport. A smaller product that fit a passport in witdh and just tall enough for american curreny would be a substantial improvement.
I wore this one all over medetaranean.  I felt safe EVEN in the Istanbul Grand Bazzar, the most crowded, pushy, pickpocket attracting place on Earth.
summary: Wore all over medetaranean cruise and ports

reviewText: In general it is a good product but as others have said, the stitching quality is poor. One of the zipper pull tabs came completely off because the small piece of fabric at the top of the zipper wasn't sewn properly. The stitches came out and so did the zipper. This happened after 4 days of using it about 3 or 4 times a day. My advice is to find a higher quality product if you plan to use it more than once.
My granddaughter requested a neck stash for traveling.  She was excited and loved it.  Will be using on her mission trips.

My teenage daughter and I bought these for our trip to the UK. They were just what we needed! We wore them like necklaces in the airports for easy access to our passports, etc. Then we slipped them around back, tucking them in like shirts for the rest of the trip. Quite comfortable and secure.

I was using this on an international flight, before I made it through my second connecting airport the zipper broke. I was almost delayed getting on my plane since I couldn't open the zipper.. had to rip it open. Very disappointing.
Went on a vacation overseas recently and the zipper on the right side would not stay closed. Luckily, I only lost out on a couple of coins and not my passport.

I love this.  Went on a cruise and never carried a purse, or had my husband carry anything for me.  I had my passport, cash stashed in plastic bags by denomination, lipstick, airline boarding passes, my drives license, and my cell phone.  I wore it around my neck under my clothes and also outside my clothes.  I would buy this again for myself or a gift for someone.
summary: Goodbye to my purse while traveling

reviewText: I used this stash at a theme park and after four hours there was already a hole along the bottom seam of the front pouch.

One of the zippers wasn't really sewn in, so the first time I opened it a big hole opened up the entire length of the pouch. I had to flag it off just to make sure I didn't put anything important into that side. I started using the top opening to store everything. The velcro holding down the flap started coming loose and was barely holding on two weeks into my trip. I never leave reviews, but this thing is too junky to be merely dissatisfied.

The only reason I won't give this 5 stars is because of the side zipper pockets. If you forget to "zip," you could lose whatever is in there. I just came back from a trip and on occasion I discovered the zipper was open. I didn't lose anything but it seems a bit risky.I do, however, like the lightweight material. It is comfortable to wear.
Worked great for a trip overseas.  Kept it inside my shirt for safety/security, and never had any issues with it!

Purchased two of these for a European Trip.  They were invaluable.  We placed our money, cards and passport in them and tucked them under shirts and out of sight.  Light weight and they DO NOT rub or irritate the skin which surprised me.  they are washable too!

I was traveling to Russia.  This pouch allowed me to keep track of my Passport, Boarding Passes, money and all essential paperwork for my travel.  It was thin enough to allow me to wear under my clothes without being too noticeable.  This has been used on multiple occasions since.
Although my wife and I have yet to go our trip, we like the design and functionality of the Deluxe Neck Stash.

The neck straps are adjustable but long. When I wear it on my neck, the cord is sorta thin (but hella durable) and it cut into my skin and also rubbed my neck. So I wore it around my waist underneath my shorts and it worked! But the cord was so long they'd show underneath. This isn't made to hold to much. The bare minimum so the pouch stays flat. Can wear it cross body if you'd like underneath your clothes. The material is breathable.  Next time I'll see if with a short elastic strap I can wear it around my ankle. All in all...worth the price. Everything I kept in there wasn't gonna fall out stolen. The only way this pouch was leaving my body was if someone either cut the cord, stole the pouch when I was sleeping , or took me along with the pouch.
summary: was uncomfortable at times but very durable and secure.

reviewText: It holds my cash and passport so I'm happy enough with it. It would be nicer if it was about an inch longer.
Well made product.  Strong.  Works well.  Just right.  Lightweight yet strong.  Lies flat.  No reason to keep looking.  Buy it.

I recently used the Lewis N. Clark Deluxe Neck Stash on my recent vacation. It more than met my expectations. The adjustable neck cord makes it so easy to fit just right. All my valuables stayed safe and secure. Great product!

Love this product.  Great for keeping Passport, pens, credit cards and cash close at hand - especially on overseas flights.  No more having to scramble under the seat or overhead locker to access your Passport when having to fill out those pesky documents!

This was a great purchase for my 10 day trip to Italy.  It has three pockets - two zippered ones on the sides and one Velcro one on the top.  Passport, money and credit cards all fit easily.  It has a very long strap, but its adjustable.  It was lightweight and thin.  You couldn't see it through some of my shirts.  I worn a tank top one day, and you could see it through that top, but You couldn't see it through all my other tops. I used it all ten days and on the airplane and it still looks brand new.  Worth every penny.

Used this to travel to Greece recently. In areas known for lots of pickpockets, I didn't even have to worry. I used this a little differently though; instead of wearing it around my neck, I wore it across my chest like a shoulder bag, then tucked it into my waistband. This made it much more secure and hidden..

This worked out really well for my summer trip to Paris, though if you intend to stuff it full, realize that under a T-shirt, you aren't hiding anything.  What this really does is take care of making sure your larger bills stay centralized and tucked away.  It was somewhat difficult to retrieve money or documents quickly, it does also make losing them to a pick pocket significantly harder.
summary: Great purpose built tool to thwart pick-pocketing

reviewText: Had this product not come with an unstitched seam, I would have given it a higher rating, however having to resew the back onto the binding has resulted in an "it's okay" rating from me.I bought this in anticipation of my daughter traveling overseas to participate in a study abroad program through her university.  She thought she know where a previously bought (and different brand) neck stash wallet was, but could not find it.The device is comfortable, she says, not stiff with enough pockets to secure her passport, money and other documents.Had it not been ordered at the last minute, I would have returned it for a replacement, but due to time constraints, I stitched it up and sent her on her way.I would recommend you order early, and QA this or similar items for defects, since loosing one's identification or cash would make for a very bad trip.

Strong construction, adjustable length strap, several compartments. Held 2 passports, driver's licenses, several denominations capable at one time.Somewhat warm, causes sweating underneath, if worn next to skin in hot climates.

It was relatively comfortable and inconspicuous while I wore it every day for one week in Europe carrying passport and cash. With iPhone in OtterBox it was a bit much. It alleviated my pickpocketing anxiety.

the last time i travelled i got one of the waist ones, and it was so annoying i never used it.  i haven't yet really used this one but i already feel much better about it.  i tried it out when i first opened the box when it came and wore it for a bit around my neck.  i don't like the toggle, but i doubled up the strap and tucked the toggle in the top flap of the stash and it works great.  i also wrapped it around my calf just below my knee to see if that would work too.  it worked just fine and i might wear it there when i wear my boots. i'm not sure if it really needs all those different departments, but that's ok. i don't think it's too big or too small.
summary: better than the last one i had

reviewText: This travel pouch is just as described. It fits effortlessly under a shirt and holds all your valuables. My husband won't use it because it feels like a purse to him, but that is just because he is ultra manly.
Item is light, durable, and was perfect for my two week trip traveling around Spain. Well worth the price. A must have for world travelers.

Despite the overwhelmingly positive reviews on this website of the Lewis N' Clark Deluxe Neck Stash , both my wife and I were dubious of what we would encounter.  Because we were heading to Kenya for two weeks, however, and because we needed something convenient that would allow us to carry our passports, money, credit cards, and what-have-you in, we purchased two of the stashes and determined to make do.Any foreboding that we might have have soon proved ill-founded,.  The stashes were everything that we wanted them to be and then some!  They made the perfect location for all our documents and, contrary to what several other reviewers had reported, no matter how hot and sticky we were, the pouches stayed dry and, far from having damp currency or soggy passports, we found that everything we placed inside the various compartments was just as dry as they had been originally.We had never carried anything around our necks before, opting for wallets, handbags, even so-called "fanny packs." After using the Lewis N' Clark neck stashes, though, we may never go back to our "old" methods, especially when traveling internationally,  If one wants a convenient method of carrying valuable paper and/or cash, one ought to look no further than here. The stashes are just right in every way.

i bouth this to wear when traveling in spain. It worked out well. i prefered to wear it over my s***, but under my jacket. it was cool enough that i didn't have to worry about taking off my jacket. the couple of time i did wear it under my shirt, it was bad. a little big, but not too uncomfortable.

This Neck Stash was purchased for a trip to Universal Studios, DisneyWorld and other theme parks full of thrill rides and adventure. It was perfect for the job. I wore it on my neck inside my blouse and outside too depending on how rough the ride was.  Safe and secure and comfortable, it is soft enough to be kind to my neck but sturdy enough to hold my important things.It has a zipper on the left I used for my ID and car key and big money I wouldn't be using most of the time. The separate zipper pocket on the right, I used for loose bills used for drinks and snacks when I was in a hurry and fumbling for bucks. The top velcro pocket is split in to two separate pockets the full depth of the bag.  I used one for a map and the other for odds and ends like post cards I bought and didn't want to bend.So there was no need to carry a purse and my hands were free all week.The neck cord is soft and long. It has a slide on it to easily change it short or long.  And when I got home with ketchup on the bag, it laundered and got even softer.This was a purchase I am very happy I made.
Great for thoes who travel and want to keep every thing in one location. I would reccomend this for long trips!

I have had other items like this and they don't even begin to compare.  I was thrilled with the flexibility of this product. I loved that I had so many pockets to use, it made organization much easier.
I have many pants without pockets and this works great for my cell phone. I do not know how I lived without it.
This has a lot of pockets and yet is very slim. Took this on a trip outside of the US and the item was lightweight, discreet and very handy.  Holds 4 passports easily along with receipts.
summary: Very thin and easy to clean

reviewText: When taking a trip to a foreign country, you need to make sure your valuable items, such as passport, money and debit cards are safe. For my recent trip to Spain, I purchased this item. It worked perfectly! You can wear it around your neck and hide it under your shirt for extra protection. The adjustable strap is a nice feature. My only complaint, however, is that the strap was made out of an itchy material. I fixed this by wrapping some tape around it, but it seems like that is something the manufacturer should try and fix on their own. I do recommend this product to anyone traveling abroad.
Used it when I went out of the country, multiple pockets makes it convenient to put passports and valuables safe when traveling.

Delivered on time and in exact specification it was described.Wife and I went on a 2 week Mediterranean cruise going to very popular pick-pocketing areas such as Rome, Athens, and Kusadasi. Worked like a charm and isn't too intrusive to everyday activities.
Perfect size and weight and price.  No complaints on this item.  I've had others that were too heavy and bulky.

We recently traveled to Europe where we heard there were many pick-pocketers. Fortunately, all three of us had our neck wallets and everything was safely hidden in front of us! The wallet is made of very thin, yet incredibly strong fabric. I always felt my money was safe. The string around the neck is a little annoying but, from what I've heard, this one is much more comfortable than other neck travel wallets out there. My only complaint is the big pocket in the back is pretty deep. Put your smaller items that you won't be able to reach for in the side zipper pockets. Other than that, this item is WONDERFUL!

If you are traveling overseas, you might want to keep the passport always with you. I have heard of passports/wallets being stolen all the time in some countries, so keeping stuff in back pocket might not be such a good idea. That is why I bought this stash. It is surprisingly light and can be used as neck stash or sideways around the shoulders. it is big enough to fit a passport (say in left zipper), one or two important documents (in right zipper) and also has enough room for cash (in top pocket - as shown in the image).

I have had this about a year now.  Used it maybe 10 times, probably more like 6 or 8.  The overall design is great, but now the seam on the back has ripped out.  You would think the people that design and make these would realize this is the weak part of the construction and make sure it is strong.  Nope.  Most people would just throw it away at this point.  What a waste.  I will try to fix it.  My recommendation is that you look for one that has better construction.
summary: Back seam has ripped out now with very little use

reviewText: i have been using it for my trips abroad.i use the main compartment for my passport, though the zippered compartment would also accommodate it.i use one of the zippered compartments for credit cards and cash. the other for coins though, it is not well fitted for coins. still, good nuff for my purposes.

I bought this neck stash for my trip to Rome, Italy.  I only used it once - on the day of my arrival in Rome - for my cash, credit cards and a pen.  It looked a little bulky to me - you can notice the protrusion under my long sleeves.  I used instead the Eagle Creek leg stash for the rest of my stay in Rome (a week).
summary: A little bulky for my taste

reviewText: I bought this for my trip to India.  I wanted something to keep my passport and currency that would be secure.  My trip was two weeks long; within the first week, BOTH of the zippers were broken, leaving only the velco pocket, which incidentally caught on all my scarves.  It's too bad because otherwise I would have really liked this product.
Simple but nice item.  Securely holds your airline tickets and passport plus any paper currency you have.
My daughter used this on a mission trip to Guana.  She had never been out of the states and she found this case kept all papers plus phone and a little money secure.
Tourist places are known for pickpockets.  Keep all your valuables around your neck to lower the chance of getting robbed or dropping something from your pockets.

I bought this for traveling throughout Europe.  I wore it in the front of my jeans for over 2 weeks, and it was just what I needed.  The pouches held all of my important items safely, and the silk fabric didn't rub against my skin uncomfortably at all.

The Lewis N. Clark Neck Stash works well. I went to England England,Amsterdam Netherlands,Munich Germany, Venice and Flourence Italy and Zermatt Switzerland. This Stash was at my side the whole time and was very please with how it didn't get itchy or anything. It did get a little sweaty in Venice, but it was pretty hot and I'm pretty sure that was more my fault than this products fault. It worked very well though and is very comfortable.
summary: Very Comfortable. Travel ALLOT with it and loved it.

reviewerName: Patrick L. Slavin "Should be Retired and I am!"
reviewText: Took a Mediterranean cruise got home with passport and credit cards, (my money took a bit of a beating but not the  neck stash's fault.). Made me feel that I was being extra careful.
I had another neck stash that was thick and heavy.  This one was light weight, had compartments, and the material was flexible for wearing it around the neck either under clothes or over.
great  no one got my good stuff  It was all hanging around my neck.  sturdy and durable, i bought one for my husband
The stash is nicely made and comfortable to wear.  It is lightweight and easily accessible.  Nice thing to have to make travel easier.

Bought this for my daughter who was going to Europe on a summer school trip and for myself for future trips.Plenty of secure pockets which used both zipper and velcro closures.Seemed sturdy, neck strap was comfortable but was overly long and lasted thru trip without problem.Good value for price paid, quality of materials seems good.Hard to hide under clothing due to length of neck strap but functioned wellHappy with my purchase.
I wore this most days for two weeks while in Thailand - 90+ degree heat and it was very comfortable and very functional. Well worth the money.

I recently used this on a 3 week visit to Germany. It works great. The design is good. It holds a passport, other papers, credit cards and money.  It is light and convenient to use. But one of the zippers broke about two weeks into the trip. I was able to use the other pocket, but this is a significant flaw in an otherwise excellent product. They need to improve the quality of their zippers.

This bag is just what I needed.  Im impressed at how gentle the strap is around my neck.  I was concerned that it would irritate my neck but it does not. It has plenty of compartments without being to bulky for under your shirt wear.
Nice size, lots of pockets, lightwieght, but the zipper pulled right off on the left side after only one 2 week trip. And I rarely opened and closed the zipper.
Simple, robust, works as advertised, what more can I ask? I wear this pouch all the time. I will recommend this product.

Wow, I have used this on 3 overseas adventures as well as other trips. It is light enough to have under my shirt and has enough pockets for me to organize my passport, credit cards and cash as well as throw in a small bottle of hand sanitizer if I don't want to carry another purse.
This pouch is sturdy and practical. It has held up for several overseas trips. It is not attractive, and it definitely shows under clothes, especially under traditional women's clothing.

I purchased three of these for my family and myself for a trip to China. It was the ideal size! It comes with 3 separate pockets, 2 with zippers and one that could closed with a flap with Velcro at the top and had a mesh pocket that divided it in two. Other consumers said the two front pockets are perfect for passport, but I personally use the big one for passports, because I carried three 60-page passports with me. I had only use the zipped pocket once, for cash.pros:light weight, could be worn under a shirt (I did it once) and if your shirt is loose it is difficult for a thief to detect it. Strap length easily adjustable. light color, so it would not show through light color shirt.cons: Sometimes it is hard to put things in the mesh pocket, e.g., the corner of passports got caught. When I used the big pocket for passport, it's a little too deep. light color, get soiled easily. It is so light that sometimes it made me jump - Where is it, do I still have it?Tips:Carrying three 60 pages passports kind was kind of heavy, after carrying it for three days the back of my neck hurt, so it's better off carrying on shoulders, it's probably even less visible.
I bought two of these for my trip to Ireland and they worked out very well. Not to expensive and kept my important papers and a few extra bucks save.
summary: A little extra measure of security

reviewText: Bought this for a trip to Asia. The velcro on the flap unravel thread by thread everytime I close and open it. After my trip, only half of the velcro on the flap remains. The zippers are not much better. They get stuck very often. Wish I bought a different one.
I took it on a trip to Ireland/Scotland. My trip was 11 days. Zipper broke on day 5.Disappointing. Used top Velcro compartment for rest of trip.
I used it for a couple of trips and it works perfect, you can hang it under your shirt and it does not bother, will keep using it for sure.

This functioned appropriately, I bought it for a trip to India.  It is obvious that I am wearing it and I did not feel comfortable with it on.  I have been all over the world and never had a problem that would require this item.
Great, lightweight travel purse/bag. It fit my passports, cash and bare essentials. It's not very fashionable but is highly functional.
Used it for our trip to Paris. Comfortable and hides well. Loved the multiple pockets, zippers, and linings. A must buy if you are travelling abroad.

I had to have this neck stash since I almost lost my wallet to a pickpocket during my last visit to San Francisco. I use to keep my wallet in pant side pocket and after SF incidence I realized the need for a pickpocket proof stash to store my credit cards, cash and the driver's license. If you are travelling in cities where you drive less and use public transportation more, you will know the risks involved in not taking necessary precautions to safeguard the valuables.This product has nice color and has several pockets (more than what I need) and it is not too bulky. I wear this under my shirt, and it features two zippered pockets and two inner compartments. The adjustable strap is very handy. It is soft and the fabric is of good quality and it appears to be durable.Some reviewers have complained that it is too bulky to put it under shirt and bulkiness is visible, but I never had this problem. My only observation is that if you have several credit cards and cash, passports and any other documents that might make it bulky. I use only two credit cards and one driver license and some $20 bills. It worked well for me.1.Lewis N. Clark Neck Stash2.Travelon ID and Boarding Pass / Passport Holder with Snap Closure3.Lewis N. Clark Neck Stash Grey

Wore this for a month straight in Africa. I liked having the different compartments, which I used to separate different currencies. I kept my passport, tickets, and money in this, and everything felt very secure. I even had enough room to stash a Kleenex pouch and very small flashlight.I know you're supposed to wear these things underneath your clothes, but I felt like a doofus doing that (plus, I'm a small person and the pouch was too big to be comfortable under my shirt), so I wore it outside my clothes like a little purse. This worked well, but by the end of my trip, the strap had broken off on one side (I just tied it to the zipper pull, problem solved) and it was super dirty. Seriously, this thing attracts dirt like no other. I ended up throwing it out when I got home, it was in such a pitiable state. I'm sure if you wear it as advised, it would hold up better though.At the end of the day, it's cheap, it works, and I'd definitely recommend it.

Took it to Europe and worked great.  I was able to not only carry my own passport and money, but after my wife's neck wallet's zipper broke, I carried her passport, money and make up, and could have carried more.  I liked the 2 zippered side pockets.  They complement the main, divided, top pocket very nicely.  It was comfortable to wear.

I'm not a "purse" person.  As I get older, I want to carry less and let the load be lighter.  This doesn't have to be used for an over-seas journey.  It can be used for every single day.  So lighten your load, dump your junk and carry only what you need to carry.  It's got a great safety factor because you can carry the purse on your neck, let it hang-down, and still not look like a dork while you use it.  Helps prevent theft, too.  Just a better way to go in life.  Less is more.
I love this item - very concealible under a shirt.  Large compartments.  Strong and easy funcitoning zippers.  Very light and comforable.

Excellent light weight storage for money, credit cards, passport etc.  Recently went to Europe and left wallet at home.  This item is much safer giving you peace of mind.  Your money and credit cards are always right in front of you where you can keep an eye on them.

I'm traveling to Europe this summer and wanted something to hold my cash, credit cards, etc. so I don't have to carry a purse.I've started walking in a nearby park to get in shape and have been using this to hold my credit card, driver's license and Medicare and supplement cards.  I originally put it around my neck and then positioned it under my t-shirt.  But once I cut my hair short, I didn't like the idea that the cord was visible at the back of my neck.  Seemed too easy for a thief to come close to me and cut the cord, so I started wearing it around my waist and tucked it inside my shorts.  Even though I am a size 16-18, I have no problem adjusting the cord to go around my waist.==========================================================Update:Just got back from my cruise around Italy and the stash worked very well.  I put the cord around my waist and tightened it up, then I slipped the pouch down the front of my pants and tucked the cord inside my waistband.  I don't think anyone could tell I had the pouch down my pants and I was careful to pull it out very discretely so as to not draw attention to it.  For example, I'd take out money when I was in the bathroom or in my transportation vehicle.My US Passport fit inside the pouch with room to spare, but the passport did make the pouch a little stiff, which wasn't as comfortable as without the passport in it.  I put my credit cards and seapass card into the zippered compartment on the side and my Euros into the long compartment going up and down. It didn't occur to me at the time, but I could have put the Euro coins into the other zippered compartment.For the trip from the airport to the hotel, and then the next day for trip from the hotel to the seaport, I wore two stashes - one on each side of my front.  I had brought extra dollar bills for tipping on the ship and I couldn't get everything into the one pouch.  The two pouches felt comfortable, but for the rest of the trip I only wore one pouchUsing this pouch allowed me to go out without my purse, which gave me a sense of security that I wouldn't lose everything if someone snatched my bag.  In addition, the weather was very hot and it felt nice not having to carry a heavy purse.
summary: I wear it around my waist instead of around my neck

reviewText: It might just be me.  Although it seems well made and sized right.  It just seems a bit flimsy to me.  I debate if I really should not give it 5 stars as it does everything it advertises itself.  When I travel out of country, I have this around my neck and under one layer of clothing.  I have my "throw away" wallet in my pocket with expired cards and a few dollars.I like the various pockets and zippered security to keep things in place.  The neck cord is a little long so I had to tie it off so the stash would fall mid chest making it a bit more concealed.4.5 stars - minus 1/2 star for long cord and a flimsy feel.  Again though perhaps being flimsy is a good thing being under clothing making it conceal more.

I planned on wearing this throughout my trip instead of a money belt. I found that it moved around too much around my neck, so I ended up using it to carry my valuables in, but just zipping it up in my jacket pocket. I know this kind of defeats the purpose, but it worked for me and seems to be a good product.

Although I won't be using this item until my trip to Italy in March 2014, I have already tried it out and it seems to be just what I wanted!!  The strap can be adjusted for whatever length you prefer and it will certainly keep cash, creditcards and other items handy, but safely hidden beneath your shirt.  The strap can even be lengthened to allow fitting it inside your waistband.  For the peace of mind this little item can provide during a trip abroad, who could argue with the price???!!!!!!!  Plenty of space, zippered pockets and security for your valuable spending money, creditcards, passport, etc..---what else could you need?
Loved this.  All the pockets worked great.
summary: Loved this. All the pockets worked great

reviewText: The packet is smooth and flat and lay underneath my shirt very comfortably. it had just enough separate compartments for passport, cash driver's license, etc.

Light, well-made, just the right size.  Not too obstrusive.  Reasonably comfortable even in very hot weather.  I used this to carry my passport and money in crowded buses and terminals in China.  There were no problems.
I only wish that the lanyard had a metal wire running inside it to ensure complete safety of the contents.
summary: Very handy and useful while travelling abroad

reviewText: I bought this travel wallet for a trip to India. It worked well to stash all my most important things: passport, cash, ID, credit cards, hotel key, a small notepad and pen, some tissues, pack of gum, lip balm, and maybe a few other small items.  I was really happy with having this small wallet, so I didn't have to carry my normal bulky handbag and risk getting pick-pocketed. And with the option of wearing this "stash" under my shirt, I felt extra secure.  My only complaint is that one of the side zippers came off the track on day 2 of the trip, rendering one of the side pockets insecure, as it was stuck open. However, I was still able to stuff all I needed into the other compartments, so overall, it was a good investment and served its purpose!
It fits more than one thinks. Very discreet and easy to store within your clothing. I would recommend it to the travelling folks.
all my friends made fun of me for having this while in Mexico. I felt the added peace of mind that my bolsa was near my corazon. entiendes? ya me neither
Worked fine and I had no problems with the construction.  It was a little large to wear full time but it did the job.

After traveling with this pouch for less than a week, and after only opening it about five or six times, one of the zippers came off in my hand when I was closing it.  Two or so weeks later, on the same trip, after only opening the other pocket a few times more, the second zipper came off in my hand when closing it.

Made of durable material, all compartments are completely secure.  I tried to adjust it different ways to conceal it beneath my shirt, but you can always tell it's under there.  Our friends at the TSA will make you take it off before you go through the scanner, but other than that it is great if you need to have your hands free and go to multiple sites and don't feel like carrying a purse.  I will also use it for playing sports and at my job, which is located in a drug infested gutter.
I haven't used this yet, but it holds everything that I need. I do think that it's a little bigger then I initially thought but it works :)
summary: It does what it says it will do.

reviewText: My dad travels a lot and that is an understatement. I got this item for him for when he was going to some shady places and he got a lot of use out of it.
summary: Got this for my traveling 60+ year old dad.

reviewText: I had used this produce 6 years ago with great success,so I ignored the warning comments about the current product. Oh, what a mistake. Two days into my trip to France, one of the zippers failed. Then, a week later, the second zipper failed. I had to suff all my travel documents into the main Velcro pouch, which made it very difficult getting specific items out of the pouch. Lewis N clark need to significantly improve their quality control!!!
This bag is perfect. Virtually weightless, you forget you are even wearing it. Even my husband liked it!

I've now taken this product with me on several trips. It's great going through the airport and customs when a passport, ID, and other paperwork is needed quickly. I found the construction of the pockets to be very well made and I like that there are multiple pockets -- easy access and "not" so easy access. The adjustable strap is great around the neck -- short or long. I wore mine on the outside of my clothing and just for the airport and customs procedures of my trip. I would highly recommend this product to anyone that travels.
This bag was light weight and comfortable to wear.Just the right size.  It came in the mail just in time for the trip.

I bought this for a trip to Mexico since a lot of trip adviser users did not recommend wallet carry there. It was nice the first couple times I used it felt very secure but the more active you are more you move around this gets very uncomfortable to use. I would not recommend for undershirt carry if you plan on going anywhere extremely humid. And it kind of defeats the purpose if  can't carry undershirt in "dangerous" areas. Other than uncomfortable, my money and ids felt safe since I could really feel it was still there.
but, honestly, I didn't use it. It is well-made and designed so if I ever decide I really need it, I am sure I won't be disappointed.

Nicely made and convenient for travel. The Lewis N. Clark Deluxe Neck Stash, Beige is good for international travel. The zippered pocked works well for a passport and it is nice that there are additional pockets for bills or tickets.

I used this when traveling around Malaysia and China.A little bulky; no one else was using one,and nothing happened.People accepted the use of the neck bag.  A little awkwardto use such carriers in general.Still, I will use it when I go back.

I used this neck stash on a trip to Mexico and found that I did not have to carry a purse.  It was part of me and held everything I needed, Passport, money, ID's, flight tickets.  If someone wants to have hands free then this is the way to go.Lewis N. Clark Deluxe Neck Stash
summary: Lewis N Clark Deluxe Neck Stash

reviewText: Get one of these if you travel often.  I love having one place to hold these important documents.  Has two zipped pouches, so in theory you can have two country's respective passports/ids/etc.Quality is solid.
It worked fantastically, but it's clearly noticeable under a shirt, so be prepared to look very much like a tourist if you're not wearing a jacket.

I purchased this item to keep my credit cards and ID safe while traveling in Italy.  On the third day of our trip, my husbands cards and ID fell out of this case onto the floor in our hotel room.  Fortunately, it happened in the room.  He closed the zipper and expected it to remain closed.  He did not realize that it was broken and just opened up again. He had used it only two days and opened the zipper which now does not close only twice.  So, I tried to be prepared and had to worry about the safety of my items for the next two weeks.  This case is worthless now and was hardly used.  I don't recommend it to anyone.  And according to return policy, I cannot return it unless I pay for shipping and accept a reduced price.  Since the total order was $13.91, I guess I can consider that money lost.
Big enough for a Samsung Galaxy Note 3 phone, a credit card case, cash, and keys. Used it when traveling and now I use it when running errands.
summary: Practical, very compact purse for travel or everyday use

reviewText: The item arrived on time in perfect condition. I took a 3 week trip to Africa and it was the perfect item to have!

I bought this in anticipation of traveling to Europe. All during my trip, I kept my passport in it and tucked the stash in the waistband of my pants. It wasn't annoying. In fact, I often forgot it was there, but I could be secure in knowing that my passport and some of my cash was always safe while I was walking through large cities. Even when it was hot and I got sweaty, my passport was safe and dry inside the little bag.
This is going 2 work PERFECTLY 4 my vacation....plenty of little pockets. Will even hv room 4 my iPod...I will hv 2 carry NOTHING and I CAN'T Lose it.:)
summary: I love it! Every traveler should hv one..

reviewText: My 16 year old granddaughter was going on a trip to France for 10 days with a student group and needed some security that her documents and money would be safe. Worked just fine, also handy at airport

I really enjoyed using this product as a wallet on a 3 week trip to China. I wore it inside my shirt much of the time, and at my hip as an over the shoulder when I knew I would need quicker access. Highly recommend the Neck Stash!

Purchased this item after reviewing a number of different products from various manufacturers. Just returned from my first trip using it and I'm very happy with it. The neck cord is sufficiently long, the Velcro closure is strong, the zippers open and close smoothly and the fabric is soft and comfortable to wear under my shirt. The multiple compartment makes it easy to separate different currencies, passports and paperwork.

I used it recently on a two week international trip.  I ad it around my neck and under my shirt, so it was always readily assessible.  Nomatter where I went, the passport, travel documents, visa, etc were always right with me and a limited chance of them being stolen or lost.
Good and comfortable. 5 star. I did not know it was with me inside. Work as it should be. Buy.

I bought this for my son to take to Japan on his first trip over seas last summer at age 18. It held up well, with no problems, the month he was there and had no mishaps with his money while using it. So glad I purchased it. I am now purchasing another for my 16 year old to take with him on a missions trip this summer.
summary: Happy with my purchase and buying another.

reviewText: Whoever designed it gave it a lot of thought.  Lots of pockets for you to organize all our your paper products, from tickets to passports to folding money. If you sweat a lot, you may want to put some of the less delicate papers in the back as a safety measure.

My wife and I ordered the product two weeks prior to a Carribean cruise.  The neck stash arrived within a week of ordering.  It turned out be a fantastic purchase.  We used our stashes to carry our passports, cruising ID cards, boarding passes, credit cards and cash.  The Deluxe Neck Stashes were large enough to handle all those items with ease, yet designed well enough that we sometimes forgot that we actually had them on.  All items were easy to get to when needed and quickly stowed away when not.  I highly recommend the neck stash for anyone traveling on an extended trip.

Pleased with lightweight yet quality of product.  Was the right size to hold passport and paper monies so as not to appear bulky when placed around neck under garments.  Zippered pockets on the side enabled easy access to compartmentized papers or monies.  Appreciated the rounded corners.

I got two of this item of both myself and my wife for a trip to India.  We travelled for three weeks and this was VERY useful in keeping documents and money handy but safe.  Easy to get to, even with a t-shirt on.  Best to keep two different areas for cash, one under the velcro flap for what you think you will need for that day, and another for your larger amounts so no one knows what you really have on you.

Just got back from a 3+ week trip overseas and put this neck stash through the paces. The two side zippers were great for money on one side and credit cards etc on the other side. The top compartment was excellent for passports. The straps are adjustable so that it can be positioned without showing a bulge. A strong plus was this stash was lightweight and never felt awkward. I strongly recommend this product.
Perfect size for passport and a few extras like cash and credit cards.  It was very comfortable to wear and concealed nicely.
summary: Just what i was looking for.

reviewText: Great product.  Lightweight, two zippered pockets on the sides.  I keep my passport in the main part, US cash in one side, foreign currency in the other.  Perfect.
My daughter took this bag to Equador.  It was the perfect bag.

I purchased this item because I'd used another pouch almost exactly like this, but by another manufacturer, during a previous long trip to Europe.  This pouch has 2 zippered compartments, but one zipper broke during my first of 4 weeks of travel, forcing me to mix items in the remaining zippered compartment, which was inconvenient.  The velcro also began to unravel and while that pocket is still usable, it's pretty clear that the item is made cheaply.  I would not purchase this product from Lewis N. Clark again and would look for a similar item from another company.
summary: Zipper Broke During First Week of Travel

reviewText: I bought this to carry my essentials for our trip to universal orlando. We havent gone yet, but this is exactly what I was looking for. It has an adjustable strap so I can tighten it so it wont fall off or hit me in the head on rides, and its just the right size for my 2 cell phones, Keys, ID & Money, & enough room for Cigs & lighter too. I am eager to see if the stay dry feature really works.

You cannot go to Europe without this.You can get everything stolen, your purse, wallet, phone, luggage,but try to steal you documents & cash - when this little stash is under your clothes - good luck.This is a must
summary: Absolute must have if traveling to Europe

reviewText: Nice,neutral color, lightweight and comfortable to wear. Well organized. Does not show soil and is not noticed under clothing. I recommend it.

This is exactly as described. Nothing surprising about it. I used it when I was traveling to Cancun Mexico. Very convenient pockets. The zippered pockets make it feel secure so I don't have to worry about money falling out.It is also very light weight, the neck strap was smooth and comfortable. The strap is also very long, you can wear it like a purse if you want. The fabric was also very smooth and it was breathable. Sometimes i had it under my shirt directly against the skin and it did not cause any discomfort or chaffing.This thing hangs directly in front of you around your neck. I don't think you need to pay for the more expensive version that features slash resistant fabric. If someone is close enough with a knife to slash a pouch hanging from your neck, you got other problems.
well made and very handy - not uncomfortable to use. As a frequent traveler there is always a concern for the safety of your passport and your money. This is a good buy

Soft and really light.  Works really well and is very well thought out with 2 zippered pockets and an large Velcro pouch with 2 separate pockets.  I find this a very good arrangement.  Money in one zippered pocket and card and license in the other and the cell phone in the Velcro pocket. I also like the adjustment on the length of cord so you can wear it high or lower.  Not my everyday wallet as a full size Spec Op but this is great for days when more security is need or no pockets.

I used this neck wallet for 10 days while I was in India.  It worked great and didn't irritate my skin when wearing it under my clothes.  My only issue with the wallet was that the side zipper broke toward the end of my trip.  I couldn't use that section of the wallet after that.Get better quality zippers and I'll give it 5 stars.
summary: Good but need better quality materials in construction

reviewText: This is lightweight, nice material, easy to wear under clothing, secure place for passport, money, hotel key, driver's license. The strap is a little long so we just cut it off shorter. Perfect for detering pickpockets and not noticeable under a shirt (not so under t-shirts, but still safer than in a pocket)
summary: Perfect size, neck strap a little too long

reviewText: I used this on my most recent trip to Rwanda. It was more comfortable than my last one, but my issue was heat against the skin causing moister to build up. by the end of the two weeks, I had black mold growing on the skin side of the wallet.
summary: great size for everything I needed but hot on the skin.

reviewText: My husband used this when we traveled internationally and was pleased with it.  However, he didn't place it around his neck as the product is intended - he thought it was uncomfortable, hard to get to and the cord visible so he was concerned that someone could easily yank it from him.  He looped it around his belt loop and kept the wallet in the deep pockets of his cargo shorts... made it comfortable, safe and very easy to get to.

I'm disabled and my Lewis N Clark neck stash allow me to keep my whole world (cash, credit & other daily use cards, cell phone, etc.) close at hand in case of need or emergency. This is the second time I've ordered and I couldn't be more happy with the product and the vendors service.
Lots of room in the pouch for just about anything and everything you could want or need to bring on a trip.
summary: Very  convenient and spacious travel pouch

reviewText: Product was shipped with no problems. However, after one day of usage in the resort pool, it didn't keep money dry. The plastic ripped at the top allowing water in.

Despite the lanyard, this item is way to stiff to comfortably wear around your neck under your shirt, so I took the string off. It's not designed for diving, so I don't really know why I even bought it. My passport did fit into it, but I ended up using if for my dive log book, which just barely fit. The roll top seems like an unnecessary feature, and it doesn't seem to help keep the water out any more than the zip closure. It just makes it a hassle to open and get things out. Even though I didn't take it diving, a little water did seep in, but at least my stuff didn't get soaked. I would not buy one of these had I known what I know about it now.
I ordered this for a purse of mine whose strap broke. It is a very strong strap and defiantly does the job. It is a little hard to adjust though.
I didn't like this product after I recieved it. Would not recommend this to anyone. Unless you perfer cheap looking.

Like the other reviewers have mentioned, the strap does have a gasoline scent to it. Washed it but the scent remained albeit to a lesser degree. If  you don't mind that, it's a good strap. Works for what it is and for the price it can't be beat.* Update 10.28.2013A little over a year later and the strap is still going strong. The gasoline smell is gone.
This strap was exactly  what I was looking for after throwing out the original one by mistake.. Made from vet strong material.

Sometimes the hook connecting the strap to my bag comes undone for no apparent reason. Definitely not what I was looking for in a strap. However, this only happens on occasion. When the strap stays on (on a 1-month streak right now), it's comfortable enough.

It took forever to get to my house, it was broken yes one of the connecting chains was BROKEN and it only extends to 45 feet not up to 48 as it says on the packaging. I just wanted a nice replacement strap for a duffle bag and this was defiantly NOT the one I should have got. Don't waste your money

I bought this strap in order to help hold my gun for my costume.It came in decent time, the envelope that it was sent in was not damaged.The strap itself can adjust to various lengths, which I find quiet helpful as the prop for my costume is fairly long.Overall, good product.

Have had a nice soft-leather briefcase that I haven't used in years because I've been missing the shoulder strap. Found this on Amazon, put it on and it looks like it came original with the bag.  Now I'm getting use out of a $75 bag sitting around collecting dust for less than $5.  If only I had thought of looking on here for it sooner!

It lengthens to a max of 50 inches. And it smells like chemicals- so give it a quick wash in the sink if it bothers you. It's a decent shoulder strap for a great price and it was comfortable enough for carrying a lightweight bag for short periods of time- that's all I expected when I bought this, so it came through!

this may have been the best transaction i have ever entered into. i know that sounds ridiculous, but when you get a solid bag strap for $5, it's very satisfying. when my previous strap broke, i was thinking i'd have to buy a new bag. i was wrong. amazon came through for me, standard.
STRONG solvent/gasoline smell.  It went straight into the trash. It was supposed to be a replacement strap for a diaper bag so there was no way we were going to try to use it.
This strap is thick and sturdy and should be very servicable for replacing your broken luggage strap; it's replacing mine.
GET'S THE JOB DONE when  if you need a spare strap for a bag, and for the price it's at? This thing is worth it

I bought this shoulder strap to replace the bad strap on my messenger bag. This strap gets the job done and does it well. The hooks are easy to use and secure the strap to the bag well. The length of the strap is such that I can easily use it as a broad shouldered 6"3' guy. The one thing to be careful about is that the strap gets easily twisted if you're not careful with putting it on. This is easily mitigated by paying a bit more attention when strapping the bag on.
summary: Decent strap for a decent price

reviewText: I do a lot of field work for my job. Crawling and climbing around bridges all the time is pretty rough on any type of bag you're carrying. I snapped the strap on my cheap tool bag and got this as an inexpensive replacement until I could find a new bag. I've used it for about a month and a half now, and it's held up pretty admirably. Inspecting it the other day, it's pretty beat up and dirty, but nowhere where the material has ripped or where I think it will fray in the future.The part that snapped on my old strap was one of the clips at the end to attach it to the bag. They were plastic and pretty easy to break. The metal clips at the end of this one feel solid and show no wear.It's actually a pretty nice looking shoulder strap, too if you're looking for a replacement for something like a laptop bag.Somebody else mentioned that it smelled like chemicals... maybe they got a dud or I got a good one, but I didn't notice any sort of smell at all to it.
summary: Good Strap, Especially for the Money

reviewText: I bought this to replace a broken shoulder strap on an otherwise functional laptop bag. This strap is not particularly high quality, but it does the job and the price is right. It lacks any padding, so if that's important to you, avoid this one.

The strap seems fine.  It extends to 45" in length, with another 3" added by the two end clips.  These clips will handle a thickness of just about 1/4 inch, and work fine on my first aid pouches, which have thick-ish strap rings attached.  However, although its box claims it has "nickel-plated swivel snaps," the clips at at the ends of this strap do NOT swivel, reducing its usefulness.  There is a very faint "rubbery" odor to the strap, which I think will disappear after a little use (and sunshine); this is really nothing to panic about!

I'm not at all happy with the fact that I had to replace it after a year and a half. The catch for the hook/catch lost its tension too quickly. I bought extra clips/hooks but the old one cannot be removed without cutting the strap. It meant that I often scratched/pinched a finger when using it. Not happy about the quality of the item. I have to buy another one of these because I have not found an alternative. But I'm not happy about it.I have no problem with the seller though.
Smells like chemicals, washed without success in decreasing odor.  I could smell it for days from the trash can I threw it away in. Would not recommend if you have a sense of smell.

I got this item thinking it was a good product. Within two days of use the clips fell apart and would not keep the strap locked to the bag. Needless to say, I ended up wasting my money for nothing. Do not buy this product, it will soon break.

I bought this for use as a shoulder strap for a laptop bag that holds a 17" laptop. The strap is of decent quality, the clips are made of metal and feels sturdy. The shoulder pad is ribbed so it doesn't slide off the shoulder. It can easily carry about 5 kgs but I think it could be used to carry a little more. It is adjustable to a wide range of lengths - the maximum length being about 115 cm. But most importantly, it feels pretty comfortable.Amongst the other replacement straps available on Amazon.com, this is one of the least expensive and consequently, good value for money.

I bought two of these for connecting luggage so we could wheel the bags and hold on to the kids at the same time.  They worked great.  There is some stress on the bag handles, but it did not seem to harm the bags.

Not too complex an item here.  It does what it is supposed to do.  Just make sure your luggage handle can take the stress of carrying around another piece of luggage since these are not permanently fastened to the first bag as a factory strap might be.  But, works just fine--easy to adjust and fastens easily.

I ordered this luggage strap because the baggage handlers tore off my luggage straps that was attached to my luggage.  Because of that it made it nearly impossible to handle my two bags efficiently.  The strap loops around the luggage handles and attached my bags just fine.  I like that I can totally detach it, so the baggage handlers cannot tear this one up.
Perfect, durable replacement for my luggage/bags.  I use and abuse these bags daily and was glad to find a good replacement strap that matches perfectly!
It broke at the airport before I departed for my trip. Terrible item. I will try to find something metal made instead of plastic like this one.

The swivel hook on my bag's strap had literally pulled apart at the swivel due to wear. I needed a good replacement for it. This strap was good enough and inexpensive (being an add on). Wishfully, it would have been nice to have a swivel hook on the ends, but this is plenty good enough.

This product works great for the job it is intended for.  I have used it to attach other bags, pillows, blankets, and coats to my wheeled suitcase so that I don't have to carry them in my arms.  It has held up well.  My only suggestion to the manufacture would be to make it so that it can be tightened more.  Currently the smallest it goes is 8.5 inches.  This is not tight enough to hold smaller objects such as sweaters easily, without having to tie them on.  I realize that is not the intended purpose of this product, but it would make it more versatile.  It still gets 5 stars for doing what it is made to do.
This is exactly as expected. High quality and durable. Exactly what I needed to simplify our travels.  It's a great product!

Purchased this 4 years ago and it as fantastic and it recently the clip broke. 1st replacement broke at the clip on 1st use inconveniencing me my whole trip. Returned for a replacement but the replacement is broken at the same place (base of spring clip) too. Returning yet again and will not repurchase. Must have changed manufacturers/ materials
did exactly what it said and made lugging bags so much easier, to pull through the air ports while we were on vacation..
Totally does the job, and does it well.  I use it to hook up my carry-on to my large suitcase as I have 3 pieces of luggage.  It's very basic, but terrific!  Recommend!
Used to secure my golf club travel case. TSA stole it on my first trip with it so I can't tell you much

It's too short to be particularly useful. If it had been about 3 inches longer it would have worked. The problem was when you tilt your suitcases on their side to roll them, this is so short that the wheels of the attached case come off the ground. The quality of construction looked good.

Highly recommend this product.  I was easily able to "piggy back" or connect 2 luggage pieces by the handles to easily transport 2 pieces of luggage with my carry-on resting on the top piece of luggage.  Have used this now 3x's and highly recommend it.Wish I had it for earlier travels.
summary: great product.  Made handling bags so much easier.

reviewText: The best strap of its kind that I have ever used. I liked it so well, I bought a second.
And it works so well!  I have a set of luggage that doesn't have those attached luggage straps, so this works great for me.  Sturdy.  I don't think it'll be coming apart any time soon.

Worked exactly as I expected. We just used two of them to haul four pieces of luggage between the two of us.  It made the process much easier.  We had one large suitcase and attached one slightly smaller suitcase to it.  I'm not sure how two large suitcases would work.  I've only used it for one trip but it appears to be made tough and should last

At first I didn't realize these luggage straps were not $1 - $2 items... so I eventually came across these and decided to try them since not many spinner luggage come with connector straps.  They are good quality, they hold very well and fit all of our luggage... they made it thru Vegas.... and they didn't stay there!

I bought this strap to hold two suitcases together while running through airports on vacation. We just got home and the strap was a life saver. My suitcases did not have one attached, so this rugged strap did its job well.
price is right. Easy to use, adjust, store. Packs in any small space. Should have gotten this long time ago.
GREAT little strap and luggage quallity! Perfect shipper/seller! I would order again in a heartbeat and give another five stars. So many uses for this product.
this is the second one I have bought, coz people steal them off my suitcase.  works perfect for carrying tote on suitcase

husband needed this strap to be able to attach his briefcase to his carry-on luggage to make navigating through the airport to the gate easier. product fits the bill, is well-made so it should hold up over time. he's already road-tested on a couple of recent trips and is happy with it.
I got this in a normal time frame but I have not had a chance to use it yet. I will be travelling next week and I will know then.

These are perfect for piggy-backing up to three good sized bags.  We are regular flyers and cruisers and from personal experience can say that one person can easily handle three pieces of luggage through airports, etc., and this can actually be done with one hand.
Works as described. I had to handle three bags through a busy airport. Hooked them together with this strap, and pull my "train" of luggage through the terminals with no problem.

This is a good strong strap and easy to use. It does put a lot of stress on your luggage handle. I wish I could find one with a hook to attach to the steel ring fastener that's attached to my luggage. This will have to do in the meantime.
summary: Very Adequate Substitute But Put Stress On Luggage Handle

reviewText: My luggage has these but if they break I am in trouble. So getting one makes my life as a traveler easier.
summary: Great item to have as a spare

reviewText: It is what I was looking for.  I like the fact that it is adjustable. I find it easier to take my carry-on when I can attach it to my main luggage and have only one piece to deal with.
I have lost one of my straps and this works great.  Good compromise for luggage that did not come with straps to attach luggage for towing in the airport.

This product exactly met my needs for travel, except for one huge problem.  It broke immediately after taking it out of the package.  While unsnapping it, the snap broke into 3 pieces, with two of the parts flying across the room.  The only way that could have occurred is the result of very brittle, poorly manufactured plastic.  It was such a disappointment. The snap is the same type as that used on dog collars.  I ordered two straps.  Both are on the way back to Amazon.
Very durable.  I have used it with air travel and just everyday use.  I have not had any problems with the product.
just came back from a trip and it broke after the 3 third time of use. this is awful, don't buy

this product is great for connecting 2 bags.The reason I gave it a 4 star rating is that in order to connect the bags, especially if they are of different heights, you need to tilt the larger or pick up the smaller one.  If the strap were longer I could connect the 2 bags and adjust after.

Have it now for about 2+ months and have tow some carry ons proving this works well. Its wide and the buckle is strong/heavy duty.The it can be expanded in length to about 15 inches long if needed.The only complaint which I have is that because of the wide of the strap, you will have to have find/use the right clip/hook for clicking/latching on to your rolling luggage.

I have only done a trial run with this strap, in my home, but look forward to the convenience it will bring to my travels.  The item came quickly when I ordered it and it arrived in excellent condition.

I was traveling with children so needed to strap my bags together.  This worked great, just make sure you loop it thru a strap on both bags!  Good quality plastic and well made, once sized did not slip.  Rolled my bags throughout the (huge) Denver airport easily with this.

VERY VERY UNHAPPY THIS TIME AROUND.I used this product before and it did hold my carry on to my suitcase. I lost the first one I bought so I ordered another one. this time it didn't hold my carry on for more than 5 seconds. The carry one was almost empty so it didn't weight much. I went through a lot of problem since i was traveling with an infant and had to push the stroller and move the carry on and the suitcase at the same time. i went trough a lot of problem only because they send me a faulty one and didn't bother to check it.
summary: FAULTY or low quality this time?

reviewText: This is a must have item for travelers. Very sturdy, adjustable. Couldn't live without it for carrying multiple bags.

I travel 3 weeks a month and carry 2 50 lb bags everywhere I go.  I have been using this strap for a couple months now to pull both bags together and it works awesome.
