I wouldn't go back to traveling without it and the convenience for the price is great.I can even get both bags, when piggybacked, on an escalator and the strap is strong enough to hold the second bag in the air without snapping or anything.
My new suitcases did not come with the luggage strap like my previous pieces.  Needed to purchase one so I did not have to lug two pieces separately.  works great at a good price.
summary: Handy to add a piece of luggage.

reviewText: It fits fine but it's hard to get a lap top bag attached since you can't attach the strap to your carry on. A second loop on the strap that attached to the handle would have made this perfect.
Simple and economy way to two luggage together.  It is very handy when you travel.  I also use to strap by backpack to my roller bag to give my shoulder a break.

I got more than I expected here.  These straps are thicker and more durable than I thought they would be, with a high-quality clasp.  I'm actually using them for a marine application rather than their intended luggage use ... I think they are perfect for the job (attaching lightweight buoys to small boat handrails that are easy to remove in a snap).
This would have worked fine if the buckles had bee the same as on my luggage, but they weren't, so I had no use for the thing.
summary: buckles did not match my luggage

reviewText: This comes in handy particularly when so many bags these days don't have a strap on them! I carry it everywhere!!
it doesn't make for an easy set of bags to move about the airport.  Use it only id you have to.  A samrt cart is better

Combining a very large unit with a small carry-on can be a problem.  The combination is unstable when trying to set them up to tend to something like purchasing tickets.  The small unit, not being able to reach the floor,  can pull the large unit over.
summary: May not be long enough for some applications

reviewText: I like the length and the strength, but it is backwards in construction.  It is nice when you have two similarly sized suitcases and want to piggyback them.

Helps you connect two rolling bags. For a couple dollars makes things roll a long. The hard thing is to remember where you put it when you need to find it. Do not leave it attached they will take it off and lose it

When you travel and just can't do it with one bag this is the best gadget.  Just strap it on and piggy back your smaller bag and go.  Pulling it through the airport or grand central it is a life saver.
While struggling with all of one's bags at the airport, this simple strap helps a great deal in keeping everything  corralled!
summary: Lewis N. Clark Add-A-Bag Luggage Strap[

reviewText: This is a luggage strap, which i was hoping to use to attached a medium-sized purse to a carry-on. Well, it's too long of a strap, so it didn't work. Nothing wrong with it if you're trying to attach two rolling bags to each other, probably.
When traveling with two heavy bags, this device makes the second one a piggyback to the first.  Very handy and strong.

Order arrived promptly (I actually ordered a few other items from Amazon.com on the same day and the luggage strap came a couple days earlier than what I ordered through Amazon directly).  This product is a basic nylon strap just long enough but not too long to hook two pieces of luggage together for easy maneuvering around the airport, etc.  As I had no luck finding one in any major stores (I checked Macy's, Target, and K-Mart), my only option was to order online.  Was very satisfied with the product and service I received at the price I paid.
Not a good strap if you were hoping to hoof a lap top bag to a roll on. It would be fine for ligher loads but not up to the drill for a raod warrior.
summary: Lasted for exactly 1/2 of a trip

reviewText: This adjustable straps fit around my messenger bag, which has to pieces of cloth on both sides of the front flap, and have sufficient length to secure it, as a back up to the velcro closures.  They have a heavy plastic clip that "clicks" to make sure they close.  Very useful.
summary: Just the right size to secure the flap on my messenger bag

reviewText: Mine is finally broken today, after 3 years' of heavy usage (I do 25+ trips a year). One of the plastic clamp is broken during this trip. I'm ordering a replacement now.

I bought this item to attach the handle of a backpack to a 22" carryon.  The strap is well constructed, but the minimum length is too long to avoid your backpack from dragging the ground when pulling the carryon. A laptop bag or purse is fine, but not anything as vertically high as a backpack.  I purchased the Travelon bungee cord for this purpose and will try it on my next trip.  I'd shorten the minimum length of this thing and it would be fine.  Otherwise, it will be fine with a checked bag coupled with a smaller carryon or purse/backpack. But for smaller luggage, not so much.
...it is a strap that holds things. Hasn't broken and come in handy when needing to secure something to the bag.
Good for connecting one bag to another, but likely to get lost at some point.  I am using to connect my laptop bag to overnight carrier, I am anticipating loosing or forgetting it somewhere.

I travel quite frequently with multiple bags.  During a flight the proprietary add a bag strap that came with my luggage was lost.  I couldn't manage well with so many bags.  This strap is quite simple and does the job.  The strap and quick release buckle are quite strong.  Make sure to attach to something sturdy.

I recently bought some new luggage,  only to realize when I got home, that it didn't have those little straps that allow me to connect multiple pieces together.  so I ordered these, and they are perfect for what I wanted.  The arrived very fats, and eemed to be of very good quality
summary: Exactly what you are looking for

reviewText: I had bought this a few years ago and it worked like a champ.  I lost it and ordered two more to replace it.  Both broke almost immediately.  The quality is really, really poor.  Both straps broke at the base of the clips, one on either side.  The other 1 star reviews appear to also have experienced this same issue.
summary: Bought two and both broke within a couple of uses

reviewText: The carrier left the package out in the cold weather.  When I opened the package and tried using the strap,  the clip broke.  It was not worth my time to try to return it.  Let the strap reach room temperature before you use it.
The Piggy Back strap works fine, just as I suspected it would.  I have no  complaints about it.  Thank you.
great for attaching carry on to larger bags when walking through airports and other areas.

If you want to have something strapped to your phone to make it more secure than just the connector (like the TASCAM iM2 Channel Portable Digital Recorder) this will not work. It too large for that function.
I travel a lot and needed a strap to piggy-back my business case to my large suitcase-this works great! Word
summary: Just what I was looking for.

reviewText: Great Product! I lost my strap and have been looking for one short enough to wrap around the handle of my carry on so that my computer backpack would not drag. This strap works perfect and the quality is good as well.

Buyers beware.  These are absolute junk.  I received 2 of these for an upcoming trip yesterday.  I took one out of the box, pressed on clip to release, arm broke off.  Opened second one, pressed on clip to release, arm broke off. At least the quality is consistant. I will be contacting Amazon to see what my option are.  I would not recommend this item.

If you've lost the custom connector that came with your bag, as I had, this will do.  In fact, this was better than my original as it can be set longer, allowing the second bag to ride lower - which makes it have a lower perceived add-on weight.Not a 5 star as it works on the suitcase handles, stressing and stretching that a bit.
I bought this for my checked baggage so I could 'train' my cabin bag up to check in. Evidently, that isn't what this is designed for. Daisy chaining two cabin size bags works as expected.
summary: Its not long enough for everything!

reviewText: This is the perfect item for trying to manage with a suitcase and a carry-on.  It's sturdy and easy to store.  Just remember to remove it from your suitcase before you hand it over to the airline, or you'll be buying a new one like I did!
I always carry a spare luggage strap, as they tend to be lost at the worst time.This strap is strong, reliable and easy to stow.

If you're trying to connect two 50 lb suitcases together, this is not the strap to use. Look for the Travelon Multi-Bag Stacker, Black, One Size.This simple buckle and strap looks easy to use but it isn't. When you're in a hurry and you need to adjust the tension on this strap, you're fussing around with it in baggage claim. The Travelon Multi-Bag Stacker has extra "tongue" to quickly pull on (like a backpack strap) so you can clip, pull to tighten, and GO.This Lewis N Clark strap is good for light loads and smaller bags.  For larger ones, this one was a pain to use. You get what you pay for. Choke up the extra $5 and get the Travelon, you'll be glad you did.
summary: I'm glad i bought back up straps

reviewText: We got several of these before our overseas (by plane) trip.  They came in very handy for stacking the bags and luggage we had to manhandle through customs, airports, into taxis & B & Bs, etc.  They were very easy to use & sturdy, and I recommend every traveler carry a couple for unexpected needs (to bind more than one thing together for easy carrying).  I used one every day in the rental car to hang my bags on (hung it from the head rest) so items didn't get tossed and lost.

It takes up very little space when not being used,  but has worked great in making it much easier to movie two pieces of luggage with one hand.My only caution is be sure that you snap the pieces together as they were intended to be snapped together. If you snap together with the one piece upside down, you'll need pliers to get them apart. So watch what you're doing and don't be stupid . . . or careless. And don't ask whether it was me or not who was stupid or careless.
summary: Small but great help in moving luggage

reviewText: I purchased two of these.  The straps are solid and do the job for which they are designed.
Was trying to locate a replacement for a Tumi T-Tech add-a-bag strap without any luck. This particular strap seems to work well enough, especially considering the price point.

Each piece of luggage that came with one of these attached were broken off by the time the luggage hit the carousel to be returned to me.  I love the portability of these.  Now before I turn in the luggage I can remove the strap to use when retrieving my luggage.  I wished these straps were more readily available for purchase before I discovered that Amazon could get it right to my door.  Thank you Amazon for another job well done.
This product was more than I expected for the price. I highly recommend for storing or traveling.

I had one of these for years. I used it to transport my suit to the gym in the morning. I ripped it and had to buy a new one. The one I bought three months ago was noticably thinner and "shoddier." The zipper fell off this morning. Save your money.

I bought two of these, and we have used them both multiple times.  They are made well and the clip is heavy duty.  Make sure to use it with a strong handle on your suitcase, as the design is such that it pulls significantly on the handle when carrying the second suitcase.  This item is also useful to attach other items, such as on small carryons or your travel pillow.  Two of these belts were VITAL to my international travel alone with a toddler and tons of suitcases/stroller/carryons/car seat, etc.  They helped to strap items together for easy transport, and I was able to get through the airports with everything in tow.  I highly recommend them!UPDATE FEB 2012:  I have used these straps on multiple trips and they have held up well.  At one point I used the strap on three suitcases at once, including a large rolling duffel bag, a large suitcase, and a medium suitcase.  It kept everything together and I was able to navigate through international airports with multiple suitcases strapped together, car seat, diaper bag, backpack, and toddler (in an Ergo baby carrier).  Without this strap, I don't know what I would have done!  Such a little product, and so important!!!
summary: Convenient and handy tool for travel

reviewText: One of my laptop case strap is broken. It looks the same as what I have right now, but it is not. It should have better quality support.

Bought this five months ago and used it on average three times a week while carrying about 6 lbs at the heaviest point and it snapped a few days ago. It's disappointing that they didn't spend slightly more money to use a better alloy in the metal clip connections on something designed to carry things.
This garment bag is good for the price, but it has no place on the bottom to attach the hanger so it can hang in half.  The entire thing is VERY long so is hard to travel with.

I have an unusually heavy laptop bag for work (two 15 inch laptops, one main, one backup), and the hinge on this strap couldn't handle it. First, the action got all wonky and wouldn't stay closed, so I had to tape it shut. A few months later, it snapped completely.That said, the cushioning is very comfortable, and I was disappointed to lose it. I would recommend it for lighter loads though.

I used this on a plane, train, and bus...worked great! I love the inflatable because you can adjust it to your needs. The prefilled pillows can sag and not be as comfortable. I highly recommend this item.

The Inflatable Pillow was designed by person who never used it. Practically it is not possible to inflate it and keep air inside, because the valve is to short. I and my wife tried to use it on airplane but without success. Valve should be redesigned. I will categorically NOT recommend this product.

I purchased this pillow for a friend who was going on a 12 hour (one way) bus trip. She had never traveled with a neck rest pillow and said it really helped the trip be more comfortable. The storage package is nice too.
summary: Improved the comfort on a long bus trip

reviewText: It's not an extremely comfortable pillow, but i"ll give it a 4-star rating based on the price. It packs down small, so it's great if you're trying to save space. I used it during an around-the-world trip where I had 15 flights over 2 months, and it lasted the whole trip. On the 8+ hour flights I had to re-inflate once, but otherwise I had no issues.

The pillow is really easy to inflate, but on that same note, the air comes back out just as easily.  It is difficult to put the valve stopper in before half the air you blew into the pillow comes out.  There is not piece like those of beach balls or swimming floaters inside the valve that keeps the air from escaping while you try to plug it.  Would not recommend the product unless you want an extremely soft pillow.

I bought this neck pillow in an airport about 9 years ago thinking even if it only lasted for the long trip I was about to take, it would have been worth it.  9 years and almost a million air miles later, it finally sprung a leak.  I can say I used this pillow often and it well outlasted my expectations. I bought this over a traditional pillow due to it's compact size when deflated, and it's adjustable by inflating or deflating to you preference.One thing to note - if you inflate it before the plane takes off, it will inflate more as the plane reaches cruising altitude due to the lower air pressure.I've read some reviews about the valve. For me, I never wanted it 100% full - that's not comfortable to me. I fill it to about 80%. So the little bit of air loss while transitioning from my mouth to closing the valve is not a concern.
I would pass on this pillow.  It isn't comfortable and doesn't hold the air well once it's inflated. This pillow, Lewis N. Clark Original Neckrest Inflatable Pillow, is much better.

Great for anyone wanting some neck support that folds away in a nook of your carry on bag.As for other buyers not being able to keep all the air inside before closing the latch, I could do it just fine. It just takes a little creativity! Just pinch the sides of the latch while blowing and pushing the closing mechanism inside all at once.
summary: Soft, durable, fits in small space

reviewText: I bought this for my most recent flight across the Atlantic because it looked economical. I blew it up (which took some skill), put it around my neck and fell asleep. By the time the captain turned off the seat belt sign, the neckrest had over inflated due to the pressure change and eventually deflated on me. So much for a rested neck.Also, I concur with other complaining about the seams cutting into your neck. I ended up having to put my hood up on my sweatshirt to avoid it scratching me.
Extremely uncomfortable. Buy the real ones that do not need to be inflated. Loses air as well, did not work for me or my family.
I only had few days before my trip to Europe and it arrived early ontime!!!!!!! perfect!!!
pillows just bursting at the seams in several places after only 1.5 hours of use!pillows were not too inflated!
Easy to pack and easy to blow up on the plane for the long rides.  Price was great and color was good.
Poor quality, started to leak air after only a few usages, did not last more than  2-3months, would not recommend

I used this item on a flight to Africa and back, 15 hours each way. I don't think I would have survived without this pillow. Really comfortable and it folds up into this really neat pouch. You could slip it into your back pocket when deflated. The price is great too.

It is very soft and best use is as a lumbar support. And you don't have to inflate it all the way. Sometimes it just needs to be 1/4 full or so. I also use it as an upper back support and as a mom breast feeding twins, I've used it in various ways to prop up the breast feeding pillow or even to prop up the baby. You could even use it as a travel pillow.

The suction-cups were warped from packaging and didn't hold well. We did use the line, though, securing it with the excellent Velcro straps at each end. We were grateful for clean, dry underwear in Salzburg.

I have herniated L5  and use these inflatable pillows on airplanes inevitably leaving them behind and having to replace them. I've owned about 5 different brands/types but this is the worst because the valve doesn't have the back valve that allows you to blow without having to pinch the valve. Also a result of not having the valve, it leaks and needs to be re-inflated often.Updated 12/21/2013: On a plane, I have to re-inflate every hour or so.  If I at all get saliva on the valve, it leaks even faster.  If I keep the valve as dry as possible, the pillow will still lose air in an hour but it will also be hard to open back up without using my teeth.
summary: Good pillow but leaks and needs to be re-inflated

reviewText: I bought this item and in two days it busted. Save your money. I'm not a big person, rather on the small size. Normal use-sage, no reasons it should bust. Not worth my time dealing about the product.Lewis N. Clark  Inflatable Backrest

So, once every couple of weeks, the suction breaks. And sure, if you're using hangers and have a lot of stuff up, they'll kinda slide towards the middle. But we're admittedly not using it in its intended manner--we have a small apartment and it is our _permanent_ clothes line, gets knocked around a bit, etc.
I used this while in France and it well worth it. Strong enough to hold several shirts and socks.Nice product

This clothesline was great for doing small amounts of laundry while traveling. It can be very long and hold a lot of clothes. It was very sturdy and held up to a lot of tension so that the line wouldn't sag.The suction cups were not necssary, we used the clips to either clip the line to something or wrap the end around something and clip it to itself to form a little loop.The only small thing that could be offered is another shorter version. A lot of hotel rooms in Europe are not very big so finding things far enough apart to attach the line to can be challenging.

This clothesline exceeded our expectations.  We were able to dry our clothes over and over again.  In the bathroom, on the balcony.  It sticks well to surfaces and holds tight.  In fact, we took two (2) and we are sure glad we did!  I recommend this to anyone who wishes to pack lightly and avoid the risks of checked luggage.

Got thise clothes lines for upcoming trip abroad.  Since trip will be lengthy, we decided to do some laundry along the way.  These clotheslines are stretchy and easy to hang clothes by sticking corners between the cords.  Will be useful.
My wife used this in her small apartment.  It worked for a while, but the suction cups would keep slipping off the walls.

Although the Rick Steves clothesline looks more substantial, I prefer this one because it has clips at the ends instead of loops.  I never use the suction cups.  There are times when it is difficult to put a loop around a knob, but I can always wrap this line around the shower curtain rod or something else, and then clip it.
It's ok for the price and works fine as long as you use the velcro. The suction cups don't stick to anything.
This is a great travel clothesline - it's fairly easy to find something to attach it to (I didn't use the suction cups), it stretches well, and holds my wet clothes.  I was very pleased with it.

I live in a small place and wash my delicates by hand,so having a clothes line I can put over my bathtub is a necessity. I'd looked at many clothes lines offered by Amazon and selected this one because of the suction cups. How else do you attach a clothes line to tile?When the package arrived, I looked for instructions on how to attach the suction cups and make sure they stay on, but found none; instead the packaging tells you how wonderful and convenient the clothes line is.It took me some time and effort to figure out how to attach both ends of the line; for once you attach one end and start stretching the line to attach the other end, it has a tendency to snap. And if you are not watching, you can get seriously injured.I still have about 50% success rate. It works best if the line is not stretched too much. The product description, however, claims that it will stretch up to 60 inches. And it does, except the suction cups do not want to stay in place when it's fully stretched.So I give this product 2 1/2 stars: it sort of works, but not entirely as it claims to.

Suction cups won't hold a wet sock! They're cute but non-functional. Luckily this product is cheap enough that it doesn't really matter. If you're looking for a better product check out the Rick Steve's clotheline or the Flexoline. Both rely on the same design which is a step up from this product.
want stay up tried ever thing .sucking cups hold they are to to small  ,maybe bigger, cups well work to try find some
summary: not worth the time and money spent

reviewText: Limited experience to date but the suction cups held the load under a full load. Velcro strap option is good feature as well. Satisfied and would recommend.Rob C.

First off, the suction cups work beautifully, they stayed on the tiles over the bath tub no problem, I even tested with a pair of jeans hung on it, still didn't fall after 2 hours.  The velcro clips are genius too, much better than hooks as they can be looped round door knobs, handles, etc.  I go to France 3-4 times a year staying in rented accommodation, often times there is not a dryer available.  A travel clothes line is really necessary.  I work out everyday so I have gear that I need to hand wash and leave dry.  Also good for lingerie since it is latex.  I am going to order a couple more.  Also handy to have at home.
I bought this for my mother-in-law who recented moved into assisted living.  without a washer and dryer in her apartment, she can hang this clothes line in her walk-in shower to dry small items.

Bought this for a three week trip and the first time I tried to use it, it kept falling off. Nothing I tried got it to work. When I finally got the suction cups to stick, within 2 minutes the whole thing fell down (with nothing even hanging on it). Fortunately I had bought some of those white clips and I just hung things on those using the shower curtain rod.

Great clothes line for traveling! We took it on a 2 week cruise and it worked so well. The clips on the ends worked so well - could loop it around the shower door handle and then around the faucet - didn't need clothes pins because you just poked the fabric through the weave and it held fine. Didn't use the suction cups so can't say how sturdy those are. But a good item to take on any trip.
Great product for the size and price.  It does stretch to 6 feet and the suction cups actually hold. Great buy.

This clothesline is great for traveling lite. The cord has good length and stretchability. The suction cups worked great on tiled shower walls; once stuck they held with quite a bit of wet clothing on the line.
I have fibromyalgia and it makes it difficult to use my hands.I have tried way to many different things.some have worked and some have not.I gave these a try and have had descent results.

I bought this item to take with me on a very long hiking trip.  I haven't yet taken my trip but I have used it at home.  The little suction cups worked perfectly on my glass door to hang up a couple of items and let them dry outside on a windy day.  The wind did not even budge the cups from the window.  I love that this line also has the options of clips on it to clip it to something as well as velcro straps.  It seems the most versatile to me.  Threading the clothing items through the rubber is easy and it holds them very well, even on a windy day.Update:Took this with me on a walking tour across Europe.  I used it every day for 3 weeks in many different conditions and it turned out to be the most valuable thing I took with me.  I carried all my belongings in a pack and this is so light it added practically no weight.  It has a variety of ways to attach it to things, which really helps when you don't know where you will be staying and how you will get to hang out your clothes.  It's still in perfect condition and awaiting it's next adventure!

These will fit someone with a very small size wrist - which I have and they still got very tight and restrictive feeling...no way would they fit the average person...need to make that very clear on the description.
I used these to help with pregnancy sickness. I had it ALLA DAY. They helped the first day!!!! So happy.

This product has afforded me much relief from motion sickness. I am required to ride with others often and it used to really be a chore because I always ended up with a migraine and vomiting, but with these I no longer have that problem, they have truly been a God-send!

I love these wrist bands.  I have suffered from motion sickness while driving through the California mountains for two years.  This year I tried the wrist bands, instead of the nausea medications, ginger candy, and Tums.  It worked great, I am thrilled!

Just got home from a cruise. We cruise a lot. For the 1st time, I was affected by rough seas and I was turning green. 1st night, formal dinner. Walked into the nearest ship store and saw these. Thought I'd like to try them before taking a medication and sleeping through my cruise. HIGHLY RECOMMEND!!!!!! They are meant to be tight to apply pressure on the pulse point. The box clearly says that if you begin to feel nauseous to press on the ball to apply more pressure. When worn correctly, they REALLY WORK! I am so thankful I found these the 1st night of our 6 night cruise. Machine washable and reusable. Best of all, no drugs.
summary: Meant to be TIGHT, REALLY DO WORK!!

reviewText: These bands work for drug nausea in many cases.  They work for me; I am much more functional. I alternate between wrists, or when the nausea is pretty bad, I use both.  Placement of the pressure point 2-1/2 fingers down from your wrist crease and on the thumb side of the two central tendons works best.  It would be nice if the diagram were a bit more understandable, but you can Google for the P6 acupuncture pressure point.  Studies have shown that this works as well as the needs, and that works for me also.  I am much more willing to do this than to have the needles sticking in my wrist for hours at a time. ;-)While wearing them, people have told me success stories on morning sickness relief or reduction.The case comes with two, you want to have both available.
summary: Amazing, when they work they really work - Sea-bands knock out nausea

reviewText: I purchased these primarily as simple wristbands to keep wet to prevent heat stroke during some hot camping days. I'm also prone to motion sickness so I figured I'd give these a shot. I've never looked into pressure point remedies and it could be placebo but it sure seemed like they worked well. No nausea or exhaustion.They are quite small but stretch a lot.
Was going to Universal and wanted to ride the roller coasters and motion rides and not feel like an old fart. They didn't work or if they did they didn't work very well. Kind of disappointed.

My Daughter was skeptical about it, she is 12 and gets motion sickness very easy. We went to Blue Ridge Park way and she wore the bands the whole trip. She did not experience motion sickness except for one portion of the road that is extremely curvy going down the hill and even then her motion sikness was very mild. So now She is a believer. We will continue testing but I think it met our expectations.
summary: My dauther was satisfied with the product

reviewText: I have been using these bands to help relieve morning sickness and they have truly saved me.  Especially when riding the subway in NYC.  I do notice that I can't wear them for extended periods of time because my wrists start to feel sore, but I put them on and take the off as needed as they work great!
I got these for someone as a gift but ended up opening them to use instead for my fiancé. Turns out one of them was ripped right at the circle on one of the cuffs. So I returned them.

I bought this bracelets to try something for my motion sickness... I didn't thought they where going to relieve or help with my nauseas when i go into sharp curvy roads, but i was and i am still surprise how they immediately help me with my nauseas when i wear them... I totally recommend this motion sickness bracelets to everyone that experience or suffers from motion sickness or have upset stomachs.... Also the bracelets where the perfect size for me but i'm a tiny person... I don't know if they come in sizes cause they would be too tight for bigger persons... I love my bracelets and i totally recomend them

I bought these for eustachian tube dysfunction.  The acupressure point is the same as the one that my acupuncturist uses with needles. Yes, that same point also treats nausea and dizziness, so I knew this would work for me.I have small wrists and these are quite tight. My wrists are just over 6 inches. If you are large boned, these will be uncomfortable, if you can even get them on. For me, they work, but for others, they might be too small and tight.The pressure point is important, and that's how it works.

My wife uses them (smaller wrists than mine) but they're even a bit tight on her.  Fortunately it's not too tight to cause pain or cut off circulation, and it does help the button push into your wrist a little better.  They're also super easy to put on and take off.Get rid of the plastic case it comes in though, that was near impossible to open!
these really work would not travel with out them not...just make sure you position them right and you are good to go

Delivery speed was great - However, when the bands arrived - they were 2 different sizes -- one is extremely tght and the other is fine. If i wasnt leaving on a trip in the morning I would return them.
no idea how or why these things work but they worked for me on a very bumpy boatride as well as an extremely windy car ride. amazing!

We were going on a cruise when I mentioned to a friend about my motion sickness; she immediately mail me the wristbands. Upon boarding we went to our cabin to unpack and get ready for supper. By the time I got to the elevator I was so sick I almost didn't make it back to the cabin. I laid in my bunk holding it's edges, moaning, and dry heaving when I remembered the wristbands in the nightstand and put them on. Within the hour I slept and awoke clear headed and able to get up and later was able to go for a light meal. For the rest of the trip I never took the wristbands off, not even in the shower. I am ready to go on another cruise.I have had motion sickness since I was a child and only sleeping would ward it off. Now I can do pretty much what I want without concern as long as I am wearing my wristbands.

I was skeptical to say the least, but a flight attendant friend encouraged me to try these. I get terrible motion sickness, in the car, on a plane, on a boat. Anywhere there is movement. These bands somehow really helped. There were a few times on the plane when I would start to feel the sickness coming on, but in the same moment it would disappear. I have used them everywhere, and I love them! Would never travel without them again.They are very small. I have fairly small wrists and these fit, but they are tight. I think they are meant to be tight since they work with pressure points on your body, but after a 6 hour flight, they were starting to become a bit uncomfortable. I would just adjust them as needed and to me it was far less uncomfortable then dealing with the motion sickness.

I take an anti-inflammatory drug for gout and it makes me super nauseous.  Used these bands and had absolutely no sign of nausea.  I have used them about 5 times now and they have worked each time.  I feel like I finally have made a pruchase that does exactly what it claims to do.  If you have nausea, these bands will help you.

I bought these for a cruise in May.  The first night, the ship was rolling back and forth pretty badly and I got really dizzy and motion sick.  I put these on and they took about an hour to work, but I did feel better.  I slept with them on, as the package says they're fine to wear for that, but I woke up in the night with a lot of pain from having such tight armbands on for so long and had to take them off.  Luckily, I didn't need them on the cruise after that.I did need them AFTER the cruise, however.  I had a really bad case of "land sickness" when I got back - I felt like I was rocking back and forth so bad that I almost threw up a couple times.  I put these back on and again they took an hour to work, but they did work.  I ended up having to wear them for two days after the cruise before the land sickness finally wore off.I would for sure recommend these; I would've been really ill if I hadn't used them.

Didn't do the trick on their own, but helped with my sickness. I paired these with some tummy drops and *most* trips are puke-feeling free. I'm also guessing that on a man or someone with larger wrists, the pressure of the band might be a little better. I have small wrists, so I don't think the pressure point gets as much love as it should to be super effective.
summary: Not the cure-all I had hoped for, but helps.

reviewText: I don't know how magnetism really affects motion sickness, but these wristbands are magical. Even wearing one on just one hand will do the trick.

the Bands I ordered was way to small and sent them back they said full refund ,but that's a lie .out of 15. plus dollars I will on get $6.48fast service but it was a real ripoff. I  have been a fan of amazon and ordered a lot of product. but they have lost a customerlewis n clark  is a RIPOFF

We bought this set for my 2 year old son several months ago, and he has enjoyed this set over any other toy...EVER.  He plays with the trains and the tracks for hours and hours.  He loves to rebuild the track in his own designs.  My son knows the names of every train (engine) and can't wait to get more pieces.  This set is worth every penny!

I bought this set for my grandkids (2,3 & 5 yrs old) to play with at my house. Had to help put it together, but the rest of the time - pure fun. The playful imagination was wonderful.  The only concern was with the bridge - little hands had trouble getting the trains through the passage and had to keep putting on the top bridge piece.  Would definitely recommend the expansion set.  Wonderful starter set to see how your little ones will enjoy Thomas and then expand from there.  Also, great beginning cost value compared with other larger sets.
summary: Wonderful set for kids and grandkids alike

reviewText: This was a gift for my one year old son's first birthday. He played with it all day. He would remove a few parts every now and then. But now he is 1 1/2 and can play for hours. He has the Thomas the train DVD. We are going to buy the add on for his second birthday. We give it 5 stars!
Excellent gift for 3 year old child.  Sturdy. Classic. Also has enough extras to make it very interesting.

My 2 year old hasn't stopped playing with the starter set that the 4 year old got for Christmas.  Searched long and hard for a "cute" set for his birthday.  It has been a huge hit!  He loves putting the track together in random patterns, but Mommy has to construct the recommended layout.  Adorable and entertaining!  Both the 4 year old and 2 year old are having a blast with it when they decide to play nice and share.  Top of bridge comes off a little too easy, but other than that we are completely pleased with our choice.  I personally am not attracted to Thomas the Train, but this set was adorable!  Would highly recommend.

bought this years ago for my son.  I still have all the pieces and when our friends with young children come over, it takes a beating to their kids playing with it.  definitely a worthwhile investment for a toy

The Thomas the Tank wooden train toys and the Brio toys can be very expensive.  This set is an affordable, good beginner set.  It is perfect for a young child interested in trains.  It can be set up in about 3 different configurations.  And it is expandable, as your child's interest in trains continues.My son just loves this train; therefore, it gets 5 stars for "fun".  It stimulates his imagination, so I give it high marks for "educational value".  Finally, as a wooden toy, it is very durable.  It can stand up to my 2 year old son throwing the pieces around.

I used palm slim leather case. but its design is so poor as I think. so I changed my palmIIIc case to handmade knitting case. but I'm not satisfied with it also. After changing case twice, the 3rd my palmIIIc case is  this product, Sumdex Padded Palm Wallet.It's not expensive and its design is not bad, just simple. I think it's the best in cases which I have used. but, the falut of this case is penholder. there's no place to be suitable for my dualpen.

Although the box is bigger than needed and the sorting tray is on the cheap side.. the kit proved to be wonderful.  The beads are nice quality and the instruction sheet includes an explanation of what the different colors represent.  The string provided is elastic but the kit also includes clasps so that you don't need to stretch the bracelets when putting them on/off.  My daughter and her friend made 5 bracelets each (including an ankle bracelet) and we STILL have beads left.I'm here to order another set so I'm ready for another rainy day.
summary: Keep busy project for young girls

reviewText: I bought this case for my Palm IIIxe, but I never really use it much anymore.  I wanted something that could fit into a pocket and protect it along with clip onto a belt.  I don't like having to take my belt off to put it on and I have velcro on it now.  The only time I use it anymore is when I take it to school and it's raining.

It is great for the price...  If it cost more than that I would not be so happy.  The case is very durable and solid. My Palm IIIc fits very well and feels strong.  I am not sure about the watertightness of this product but it is definitely splash proof.  I don't like the velcro that is supposed to keep your palm in its place. So I just put the palm in the case and let it float in the case. If you want to carry your palm around in your hand and just use this case as a little more protection. It gives you more peace of mind, you don't have to worry about dropping it as much.

I just got this case and for 5 bucks it is a great buy!  I have a Visor and have no problems with the velcro attachment interfering with my hotsync..it actually improves my hotsync because now my Visor rests in the cradle and doesn't get stuck there like before.  I placed the small velcro tab right under the Springboard door.  THe case is firm and padded enough to offer enough protection yet not super bulky.  It also has a strong belt loop on the back for easy carrying on your side.  THe silver color gives it a sharp look and the battery slots are great to have for carrying some extra juice!  All in all this is a great deal.
summary: For the price it is a great looking belt case!

reviewText: This padded wallet is great for PDA's.  It's main purpose is protection. Because it is thick, it is a but bulky, but that's better than another cracked PDA!It has an elastic strap to hold a spare battery, the zipper works dependably and never gets stuck, and it functions well.It has a belt loop so one may run a waist belt through it, but I found it too unsightly to use that way (except if I am hiking, etc).  No more broken PDAs!!!
Very sturdy, protects the device in my briefcase.  Had it for years and it is still going strong.  The case has elastic loops for a stylus or batteries.  I'd buy it again.

Great case. Lightweight, padded, good price.One complaint I've read is that people say their Palm rocks a little when they use it. Here's what I did to prevent that: It comes with a square piece of velcro that you attach to the back of your Palm... I cut that in half, and used one piece at the top of my Palm, and one at the bottom. That way, it is not rocking on one piece.Provides great protection, I am very happy with it. I use a Palm IIIC, by the way.

I bought this case to use with a Handspring Visor.  Unfortunately the  velcro that you use to attach the Visor to the case must be placed high  enough to not interfere with HotSyncing.  This means it must be placed on  the Springboard module cover, which can slide off easily.  I suppose that  this would be a problem with any case which uses velcro to attach to the  Visor, but if I had known I would have bought a different case.  Overall  its a fine case -- just not for the Handspring Visor.
summary: Doesn't work well with Handspring Visor

reviewText: I use this case to hold my iPaq and keep it protected. The case is very basic, no extra pockets or anything, but there is a pen/stylus holder that will hold a full size stylus.One problem I have with it is that you need to stick double-sided velcro tape to your PDA for it to stay put. Since the iPaq has different expansion sleeves, I need to put this tape of each one of them and I'm not really crazy about sticking velcro tape on everything. Otherwise it's a good case for the price.
Great product, simple but perfect for my Palm. The silver color is cool and the protection is great! This is the type of products I like, simple, very nice price, high quality and cool design !
This is a very nice looking wallet for PDA's, but is too big for the Palm m130.

This case is fits like a glove.  This is an excellent case, in many ways superior to those priced in the $20 - $50 range, if not truly superior.  I have yet to drop my Palm IIIc in it--hopefully, I never will--but it looks competent enough to protect it from damage.The case is very firm, but absorbant.  I'm told it's waterproof, or water-resistant--let's hope I never find out.  I got the yellow one (or gold) and though the color doesn't look the same in real life as it does the Amazon.com picture, I still like how bright it is.What I don't like is that it provides you with a velcro thingy to secure your Palm inside.  No thanks!  I refuse to deface my Palm with scratchy, nasty old velcro.  I mean, if you put that velcro sticker on its back, that's forever.  No sir.  I'll just have to be careful opening the case, so that it doesn't fall out.It's stylish, very modern-looking.  If you want an inexpensive alternative to the other, very similar products for protecting your PDAs, this is your savior.  At [the price], how can you go wrong?

After trying out several cases for my Compaq iPaq PocketPC, I decided to give this one a try. It fits an iPaq with the Style Pack (or dummy jacket) that came with the iPaq. The hard cardboard material protects the iPaq very well, and the belt loop is very useful for carrying it with you always. At this price, this case is hard to beat!

I have had my Sumdex padded palm wallet for a year. I got it for my handspring visor. This is a particularly handy case because of the strap on the back of it--you can loop the strap of a satchel through this strap on the back. I have a shoulder bag and have this case on to the strap, so I can access my visor without opening the bag. The battery loops are a perfect way to make sure you are never without spare power. Whereas the other reviewer I read has made use of the velcro, I determined the case was more useful for transporting than for cradling the visor permanently--mine is not fastened into the case, and if that's what you'd like to do with the case you buy, I don't recommend it--the zipper around the outside (all you need to keep the device in the case without velcro) would also, it seems, be annoying to contend with when you're actually using the device. However, if you want to have quick, easy access to your handheld while still protecting it, this is a great case. And the price is right.

I bought this case because it looks very cool (the silver one). It is also inexpensive and actually protects the PDA, unlike several other leather flip/slim/executive model cases I've bought (and returned) in the past. 2 problems though: velcro is terrible. The PDA (in my case a visor) rocks when you use it, and have you ever tried to pull velcro apart quietly ? Like in a meeting ? Also the battery holders. I have never found batteries to be a hard to find item, and if your batteries run out because you aren't carrying a spare pair, you must be very distracted. I removed the battery holders and the velcro, and hot glued the snap case that came with my visor (otherwise useless)into the case, so I can snap my visor in and out. Now it is really a cool and functional case. Many compliments on it.

reviewerName: Porter B. Hall "owner of Poor Yorick's Almanack"
reviewText: I throw my PDA in my backpack, and I throw my backpack around when I get to work or when I get home. It's a good thing it's encased in this wallet--it never gets crushed or scuffed. It's not much bigger than my Handspring, either. I am glad I bought it.

This case is the one I've been looking for since I got my Palm over a year ago.  First of all, the price is right.  Other cases, inferior ones at that, regularly go for two to three times the price of this one.And what makes this case so special?  It's lightweight, padded on the inside, and most importantly, it's quite rugged on the outside.  Unlike some case which have a soft flimsy feel, this one has a sturdy toughness which leads me to believe that I could drop the palm in the case from a substantial height without doing any damage.  No, I haven't tried (though it is tempting), but the case really feels more durable than other cases I've seen and for that reason I recommend it highly to anyone.

Simply, this is a PDA case, and functions just fine as one. Obviously it is larger than your PDA by a bit, as it must protect it, fairly slim, though. Zipper operates smoothly, and the padding works well, protects nicely. The interior velcro will hold the PDA well, but I am not sure what the elastic is for, possibly a pen, but certainly not your stylus. That's about it. A good case for the price.

Given how cheap this case is, it's not a bad choice.  It's certainly functional and serves as good protection for your handheld.  On the other hand, it looks cheap.  Definately not for the professional.  Further, your handheld is mounted into the case with velcro and makes for a very loud noise if you need to remove it from the case.  I very quickly upgraded to Handspring's own slim leather case, which is only a little more expensive but looks much better.  As a budget basement case, though, this product is worth a look.  Maybe you'll like it's aesthetics better than I.

Though this PDA case may not be the most fancy, it's rugged and does the job well.  Because of the material used, it will absorb some of the impact if you drop your PDA while in the case.  This is a great case for the money.  I recommend the silver/gray color.
Great case, fits my Jornado great. small, light and protective. Cant beat the price. I have bought other. more expensive cases but I always fall back to this one, mainly becuase of its size.

This PDA case is almost perfect.  I have found it to be durable and effective at protecting my Palm from harm.  The bright color makes my Palm easy to find on my cluttered desk.  If the case had pockets for expansion cards and so forth, it would be perfect!

I purchased this product to protect my PlamIII.  Since I have started using this product I have dropped my PalmIII onto a cement floor twice with the same results both time---absolutely no damage to my Palm (Whew! ).  As  an added plus, I love the belt loop on the back of the case.  Its a nice  feature not found on every model.

I like this case. However, it's not as cool as its brother, the Sumdex leather zippered model. However, I recommend buying this one. It has Star Trek appeal (silverized look is a little spacey), and has a belt loop. A belt clip would have been better, but this model could be user-modified with a clip. Buy and enjoy the final frontier.

This beautiful protective case for my Handspring Visor Deluxe is the most eye catching color that I'd ever seen. People ask me, what's inside? I just blush and show it to them. They love the color and style of this case and so will you!Recommendation: Strong Buy
summary: Excellent Protective Case for my Hanspring Visor Deluxe

reviewText: Yes we do.  This Palm Wallet is great protection for your palm.  It's not like most Palm Wallets which have the tendency for your Palm 'slip and slide' around with the chance of lossing it.  The zipper keeps EVERYTHING in!  Also a nice touch is to secure the Palm with the hook and loop tape that is already there.  The only drawback I have is that with the particular Palm I own (Palm 3xe) it is a little challenging to zip up when having the extra 2 batteries in their loops-hence the 4 star rating. But to circumvent that I just leave one 'floating' at the bottom.
summary: Does the world need another Palm Wallet?

reviewText: I looked long and hard (web searching, store browsing) before I found this little honey at a Fred Meyer's store (for crying out loud).For under 9 bucks, I now have my digital companion securely strapped to my belt. Its belt loop allows you to thread your belt through the loop. No snaps or velcro to worry about coming undone. Word of advice: strap it to the side of your body that has the belt buckle. This way, when you unbuckle your pants, it won't slip off the end of your belt. As long as you check the threads on its belt loop to make sure they're standing up to normal wear, this thing will never come off (unless you find yourself without your pants, that is).It's slim, cushioned, and due to it's side-zippered design, when you swing your arms as you walk, there's no protruding top flap to brush against. I have the silver one and, although I first felt a little strange wearing it, I now find it quite comfortable and rather enjoy feeling a bit like a member of the Borg collective : )I don't use the inner velcro attachment. I simply unzip the pouch about 1/4 of the way open to access my PDA from the top. My Palm IIIxe is very secure inside and doesn't shift around. The pack itself fits nicely on my hip and allows me to sit or walk without feeling like I'm being jabbed in the ribs.I highly recommend this product. If it had inner pockets for credit, ID, or business cards, it would've ranked a "5".

The Sumdex Padded Palm Wallet (Silver) is the answer to a prayer.  When I rec'd my Palm IIIxe for a Christmas I was elated.  After getting acquainted with it, I realized that I would need some decent exterior protection for my Palm. I heard many horror stories (i.e., a Palm dropping from an owner's hand and hitting the ground, a Palm falling into the toilet).  My problem was to find something adequate for protection, small enough to fit into a small purse and not double as a wallet, and one that is reasonably priced.  I shopped around for months looking for one that would fit my critieria.As always, I came to Amazon, to shop around for a little of this and a little of that and decided to check into the electronics department.  I must admit, initially I didn't see the Sumdex Padded Palm Wallet (Silver).  I came a few weeks later to purchase the leather Sumdex Palm holder and I notice the silver Sumdex listed.  I ordered it without hesitation.I just rec'd it and it is quite a treat.  It has adequate room, the batteries fit snugly in the case and it fits great into my SMALL purse. Not to mention, it is VERY attractive. This is an XLNT(!!!) buy.If you are looking for the things I have listed above, this is the one.  I notice the other colors (yellow and sapphire blue are the ones I know about) had sold out (I am sure AMAZON.com will replenish) but it just goes to show that this is a popular item.

I purchased 2 of these and they work great. The only improvement I would suggest is if the manufacturers could quite the mechanism down a bit...it is not loud, but not as quiet as I think it should be. Other than that, the images are clearly defined and fill the entire room with articulate imagery. I really like these!
Item is great, got them for a costume my son wore for his birthday and it was a big hit. The wings brought the costume together and just added the last finish.
summary: Item is great, got them for a costume my son wore ...

reviewText: Love this.. I have had mine for at least 18 years.. still runs great.. I'm going to replace the light bulb this year but that's it.. great for Halloween nights before bedtime.. if you stare long enough .. the images look as if they are moving.. I would love to find one of the light shows like the one in sleepy hollow.. but this is pretty neat without the danger of candles and a headless horseman.

I really wanted a shadow lantern similar to the one in the movie Sleepy Hollow. Instead this was all I could find. The price is right but that's about all to recommend it. First it's an energy hog. I went through two sets of batteries in 48 hours. The lamp was not bright either. So I tried wiring it to a power supply but the lamps keep burning out. The poor quality reflector and dome distort the images. I'll use this as a stopgap measure until I can find a more suitable lantern from the movie.
This went perfectly with his Halloween costume and he has worn it on numerous occasions since. I don't expect it to last forever, but that is fine. There were no defects in the one I received.

We ordered this toy for our 4 year old son, though it is better suited for someone 7 or so.  Vest is dry clean only as it is 65% wool!  There is a digital voice recorder which holds about 7 seconds of pretty clear recording.  There is a complete fingerprint kit (which we took away from our little boy), including a jar of white dust, feather, ink pad, scotch tape and cards for holding prints.  Also included are a very cute (plastic) black hat (my son LOVES that), a working flashlight (one AA not included), plastic badge, two ID car's and case to hold them.This is a real bargain.  If it ever comes back, I'm ordering several for presents to friends.
summary: Unbelievable bargain and a happy son!

reviewText: the spots where the elastic is joined to the soft vinyl tore with in days of wear. Cheaply made wish it was better. Kid LOVED it while it lasted.
The Inflatable buzz lightyear costume jet pack did arrived on time.  My son did like it but it did not last long. It was OK gift for my son.
This was the last piece we needed to complete my son's Buzz costume. Great quality and went so well with his outfit you would've thought it all came in one package together.
This is inflatable and kinda cheesy. Not quite worth the price but I will be giving it to my nephew with a Buzz costume for Christmas so hopefully he will like it.
Our buzz lightyear costume wouldn't have been complete without this adorable jet pack. My four year old son was obsessed with this.
Product was received quickly and the quality was excellent.  My son loved it. Look forward to further to my purchases.
Definitely purchase!  So worth it!  He plays with his wings still even though he doesn't have the costume on!!! It made the outfit!
summary: Don't buy the costume without these!

reviewText: Fit my 3 yr old nephew perfectly, it even fit his little 1 yr old sister!  was exactly what I had expected, very good quality for the price and has held up very well considering how rough he is! It also arrived very quickly.

seriously, i think this was around $6-$7 when i bought it for a haloween costume. my 3 yr old plays with them ALL the time. they are actually pretty dang cool. the stings just broke on them but that was from a 10 yr old pulling them. i am going to buy another one. really cute too.
The wings were just what we expected and really made our son's Buzz Lightyear costume look that much better.
pissed... the picture deffiently doesnt make it look inflatable, thought it would be plastic. to late cause i already ordered it.
My four year old "flies" around the house. Inflatable wings are fun and lightweight. The are a little larger for him and he hits everything when he turns.

I bought this to go with my four year old son's halloween costume this year.  It worked well, and made the outfit! The only thing I wasn't happy with was one of the straps broke while we were out trick or treating. The thread broke. It was easily fixed though and didnt slow us down a bit! Over all I would recommend this product for short uses.

This is an inflatable jet pack, which is perfect, because when kids run by tables or a sofa, they won't get hurt ( or knock over furniture). This holds up well to constant use and is worth the money for a boy or girl that wants to fly like Buzz Lightyear.

this arrived quickly. I actually bought two the first one had a slow leaking hole but did not want to hassel with a return. i ordered another for my sons birthday cuz he loved it so much and this one has lasted us. My son loves it how ever he does knock down almost everything when he wears them but he never wants to take them off.
it dosent look to be inflatable but it is and way over pricws for a claw machine toy.Buzz Lightyear Jet Pack,One Size Child
La mercancia es de buena calidad, y llego a tiempo segun lo establecido en el sistema. Lo recomiendo ... Venezuela

These are fun inflatable wings with small elastic straps to put over arms.  Nothing too extravagant but my kid loves them.  The only annoyance is that the plug does not stay in consistantly (same plug as found on a beach ball).Package arrived safely and on time.

Ordered buzz lightyear wings for Halloween. Received notice 2 days later that they were out of stock.  That should be updated with Amazon and the company selling through Amazon when things are out of stock.  Waste of time. On the brighter side, my money was quickly refunded. Found wings at a site store instead.
summary: Buzz wings out of stock, notified after order placed

reviewText: Very fast shipping!Inflates easily and stayed inflated well.The elastic harness Velcros, so it's safe and it's gives a small 1/4" adjust-ability to their size.They do stick out quite a bit from the sides of the child, but I think it adds to the excitement for the child.a lot of fun, The material is the same as that as a blow-up pool, so there is some durability, but seriously you have to expect that it can easily be punctured just the same if you are not careful.
I bought this for my nephew and he tried sleeping with this wings on.They are lasting even longer than I hoped they would and would recommend this product.

The toy came deflated and folded in a plastic bag.  When opened the toy was stuck together and when we tried ti unfold it and open it up it was completely stuck. When pulling it apart it pulled all the paint and colors off. It looks horrible. I don't recommend this product

This is an awesome product.  We love it.  My son wore it for Halloween and has played with it many times since.  It has held up so well.  No holes or tears, which is quite surprising, because the boys are pretty rough on it at times.  Great price, great item.
summary: A Must Have for Buzz Fans

reviewText: a bit too big for birthday boy (turning 2) - but he loves buzz light year so much it wont matter ;o)

Be very careful when ordering from this company.  They will NOT take any returns, no matter if it's their fault. I received an item that was missing parts AND not as pictured and they refused to take it back....oh yeah...there's fineprint about returns right before halloween.BUY YOUR COSTUME FROM ANOTHER COMPANY!
my son loves these and loves to fly around with them.  They seemed a little expensive for what you get but they did make is costume.
My kid loves the buzz wings... we got him the costume and this jet pack complements it perfectly. good product
POS this think is junk SUPER LOW QUALITY
These wings are blowup.  They just do not stand up for an older child because they are so plastic.  Young children should enjoy them.
It was exactly what I wanted and needed! I got what was advertised :) the purple on the outside packaging versus the purple on the actual wings was different, but it wasn't a huge deal

My 3 yr old loved it! He was Buzz for Halloween!  He got alot of attention with the jet pack! I love that the wings are flexible! If he wasn't paying attention and bumped into someone- it wasn't a big deal!  He still likes to put them on and run around the house with it on!
Perfect accessory to compliment the Buzz costume. Inflatable and seems to be made very well. I recommend this item with or without costume purchase.
summary: A must have for your little Buzz fan

reviewText: The price was very good for the wings.  I didn't love that they were blow up instead of fabric but they fit well and were easy to use.  The price was right as well.

The item has a strong plastic smell when first opened. It wasn't the best quality. But, my son enjoys it. The strap is an elastic band for both arms, which I can foresee breaking very soon. It should've been an adjustable strap to accomodate multiple sizes and comfort. It really isn't that expensive to add. Kids have a blast with it. But, overall for the price, its a good product with the exception of the new plastic smell ...
summary: Good product, lots of fun for the kids

reviewText: This was the icing in the cake. My son was so happy and got tons of compliments on his buzz lightyear costume.
thank you so very much you are the best, i cant wait to buy something else from you. because you are so very awesome. gold star

This completes a buzz lightyear costume. I had two problems with it. The first was that I had to poke a hole in the plastic where the air is blown in. The second problem we had was a hole (in a different part) that created a slow leak. Once found, we put clear packing tape over and have had no further problems. Would definitely have purchased again.
summary: Must have accessory for a buzz lightyear costume

reviewText: The design looks nice, but it won't stay inflated.  It's full of pin-hole leaks (3 of them), and the sealing around the vinyl is weak in many areas where I expect further leaks to occur.It also smells bad (like many inflatable toys), but I guess that's to be expected.I would recommend against buying this.  Or, if you are going to buy it, buy 3 so you have spares.

I was able to make a buzz lightyear Halloween costume out of these wings, a buzz tee shirt, and a blue hoodie underneath. The wings hold their air and I was surprised that the flimsy elastic straps still haven't broken. A great toy for buzz fans and their parents, because they can't do too much damage when they bump into everything with their wings. My boy flies around outside, and then I can just deflate and put away for next time.
These wings made my son's costume complete. While they are just inflated, they keep their shape and are very durable. We also taped glow sticks to make it very realistic.
I bought this as a Christmas gift and he loved it. i didn't realize this was inflatable buzz lightyear wings.

He was happy with the Buzz Lightyear costume which arrived a day earlier, but the Jet Pack was the winner!He did not take it off except to go to sleep (watch for things he could knock off the side tables).I love it too -- it's inflatable, thus light and can be stored away easily.
summary: Made my son skip with joy

reviewText: plastic is a little fragile, but it will probably last as long as his attention, my grandson just loved it
Adorable costume piece! My son was so excited over this piece. It really made the costume! We will be using it for play for the rest of the year

What a disaster!! I ordered item on Oct. 17 and seller shipped Oct.18 with a delivery estimate of Oct. 21-26. Package never arrived. I waited until Nov. 3 to contact with no response. Tried again Nov. 6 still no response. Never will answer a phone call either. On Nov. 8 I filed a claim with Amazon because I was out of options and package had yet to arrive and the next day Amazon refunded my money and 2 days later the seller decided to finally reply to my email by telling me my money had been refunded. Good Timing! Thank God for Amazon's Guarantee! I can only hope that Amazon will shut this dishonest seller down and never let him try to screw anyone over ever again. BEWARE OF THIS SELLER!!!
summary: An Absolutely Horrible Experience!!!!!!! Do Not Buy!!!

reviewText: This jet pack is easy to inflate, and my son can put it on himself. I like that it's inflatable, so my son can wear it as long as he wants, and then when it's time to take off, I can just deflate it, fold it up, and put it in my purse. The only problem we've encountered is that it rides up pretty high on my son's back, above his shoulders, so he keeps pulling it down lower, but it won't stay. It's pretty durable for an inflatable. My son crashes into things, the dog has stepped on it, but it still works.

The rating I feel is fitting I liked it, my son enjoys it.The straps could be have little more grip to hold it on.I bought it for my 2 Yr. old, He enjoyed playing with it more than wearing it so I thought it was useful in many ways so kids 2 up I recommend this product for.
Great!
this is the second one exactly like it that we've purchased because the first one popped.  He does tend to be kind of hard on toys so it would depend on how rough your kids plays.
summary: Our five year old would give it 5 stars, but...

reviewText: My nephew loved this.  It was simple and not too expensive. Much better price than I found anywhere else. He was able to fly around and pretend to be Buzz without difficulties.
summary: Buzz Lightyear Jet Pack, good price and sturdy enough

reviewText: Purchased for Halloween for my 5 year old. Really made the costume. Now my two year old plays with them everyday. I didnt have any problems with them staying inflated. Great product for the price. Kids love it!!!
My nephew loves this . Wore it for Halloween and played Buzz at home for weeks afterward. A terrific item.

This was a great accessory to my son's Buzz costume this Halloween. All the other boys who only had the Buzz without the wings were thoroughly jealous.I took one star off because the elastic that goes around the arms to keep the wings on is very flimsy and not well attached. It actually broke off and we had to staple it back on. Thankfully the part that the elastic attaches to is not inflatable.
summary: Great Accessory, bad elastic arm holes.

reviewText: My Grandson loved this, but the straps on it were starting to tear away after a couple of days.  It wasn't very expensive, so I would probably recommend this.
Got this for my 3 year old and he loves it. Pretty sturdy for an air filked toy. I would recommend.
Sturdy, easy to use, really animates the buzz light year costume.  Kids love wearing it for play too!!!  I recommend.

i bought this to enhance my sons halloween costume. he absolutely loves it. we were told over and over how awesome his wings were and no one had seen anything like it. he wore it all night and it is still usable.
Child loves the wings, he is constantly running with them in the house and outside with playground slides and swings.

This is a blow up wings. The strings to wear them are very small for my 3 year old, so I don't know how someone bigger could use them.  Ours has already got a hole in it.  It's cute, and big, but not very durable.

So my biggest gripe is that the plastic is REALLY stinky ... like toxic smelling plastic stinky.  I should note that I'm not one of those moms who buys only BPA free plastic.  I don't buy low VO paint.  But this toy smells.  I am thinking about washing it to see if that cuts down on the crazy toxic plastic smell that fills the whole room when the wings are in it.Other than that, my son like them.  I feel terrible letting him wear them since they smell so bad, but he thinks they are great.  I hope they don't pop too soon.
summary: My son likes it, but it's flimsy and STINKY

reviewText: Ordered this as an accessory to the Buzz Lightyear costume my Son wanted to wear for Halloween. Was easy to inflate and put on. However, there is a pretty heavy chemical smell that comes off the item - not sure if it's from the materials it's made with or from the coloring on the jet pack. Rating would have been 5 stars if not for the smell.
summary: Very cool addition to the Buzz costume

reviewText: Unfortunately I waited until the night before Halloween to blow this up. I didn't want my 2 year old to see it and get too excited. The seams were undone on the top and air wouldn't stay in. So now my husband and I are trying to use an iron to melt it together enough to hold some air. Disappointed.

I bought this product because I though that the price was very good. I had dubs about the product but let me tell you that my son's costume wouldn't be as nice as is it without this Jet Pack.  It has perfect fitting for my two and a half years old boy. I guess it can be used for a child until 6 or 7 years old. In my opinion any Buzz Lightyear will look better with this jet pack.I would buy this item  many times again.
summary: Excellent complement for any Buzz Costume

reviewText: We purchased this for my 2 and a half year old son for his Buzz Lightyear Halloween costume. They were awesome, he loved them and thought he was the real buzz. We still have them for dress up.

My grandson is really looking forward to enjoying this Halloween with his complete costume from Buzz Lightyear, he is really excited that his costume is already shipped and just waiting for the day to come so he can wear it. thank you for making this Halloween an exciting one for him.

The wings come with a warning that they could be a choking hazard. *Fortunately* this risk is 99.9% removed by the straps that simply do not stay velcroed. Our son is only three (and a skinny three I may add) and already we have had to put the straps on the largest setting. If we can manage to get them on him without the velcro undoing, the first time he tries to fly "to infinity and beyond" at least one strap snaps. I am going to try to sew them shut, because he LOVES LOVES LOVEs having Buzz Lightyear wings, but I certainly wouldn't buy them again.
summary: Wings work better when they stay on

reviewText: I ordered this for my nephew who is obsessed with Toy Story. Was really sad that it never made it to my house to give the little guy on Christmas. Order from another company if you'd like to receive it!

I ordered the jet pack for my 6 year old grandson for Halloween 2011 to go with his Buzz Lightyear costume.  Unfortunately, when we blew up the jet pack the day before Halloween and my grandson wore it for about an hour, it began to deflate quickly.  We found a hole but were unable to patch it up so that it stayed inflated since the break was in a crease in the plastic material.  Luckily, I was able to find and purchase another jet pack at a nearby store in my city which held up fine on Halloween.

I purchased this kit for my son for halloween.  We had three trick or treat times to go to. The first one was at my work, the wings worked great.  The second was trick or treat around the neighborhood the same night.  Worked fine again.  The third was the next day at my mom's work, I went to inflate the wings for only the third time...there was a little hole on one of the seams and they would not inflate.  I know that it's a kids toy and it's not supposed to last forever, but three time of inflating?  I expected more.

I just have to say that this totally made all of us smile when our son stood in front of the mirror and saw who he was supposed to be.  We constantly heard "look, there's buzz!" the entire time at the local mall.  It was great!  If your son is going to be buzz, u have to purchase this as it completes the costume and adds a ton of excitement for them to dress up!  You won't regret it!
my son loved the jet pack but on of the straps broke within a few days of play wish it would have lasted longer
Bought this for my son as a Christmas present.  Exactly as represented.  Its a blow up toy and no holes  - he loved it!!!!
Got this for my son to use as part of his Halloween costume. Everyone loved it! My son still loves it, he plays with it all the time pretending he is buzz flying around.

My son saw these when we were buying the other parts of the costume and we both thought this would be a cool addition to complete the costume. Just got them today and they are a cool addition and make the costume. Have to keep telling my son to be careful though, only thing that worries me is that the item is a blowup and could be punctured/ripped if snagged on something. Other than that though, they are pretty cool.
summary: Very cool add-on to complete the costume.

reviewText: These seriously make the Buzz costume. My little 4 year old is particular about what he wears if it is uncomfortable he takes it off but these he wore all night long! And they just complete the buzz costume! So many compliments on how cute he was from total strangers! If getting the costume spend the money and order this accessory too!
Genial, el unico detalle es que las tiras que lo sujentan a los hombros son fastidiosas y mucho mas para un niño.

I bought this to go with my sons Halloween costume. He LOVES them!  It will slowly loose air, but I just blow it back up when he wants to play with it.  It has lasted the last two months and my son is not very gentle.  I will say though that my son just turned three and the straps that hold the wings on are kind of small.  I imagine they would cut into a older child.

These wings are a great size and are very lightweight, so they are comfortable for my toddler.  They really add that special finishing touch to the basic Buzz costume.  My son LOVES them and doesn't want to take them off!

As soon as I opened it out of the packaging, the plastic reeked terribly. Once we got over the smell and tried to inflate it, we realized that it had a leak which kept getting bigger. The seams are very flimsy. My 4 year old son has been talking about dressing up as Buzz for Halloween and insisted on the jet pack. He's going to be so disappointed when I tell him that it doesn't work. This toxic piece of junk is headed straight for the landfill unfortunately, unless I can somehow return it for a refund. Would definitely not recommend this accessory. Wish I'd paid more attention to the reviews (which I usually do) before ordering it.
Very happy with the wings.  My 2 yr old grandson loves them.  They do make the outfit.  My grandson's only problem is "I can't fly".
My son was very excited to get this "rocket pack" but, after 3 days it sprung 2 leaks and we have been unable to plug up the holes with super glue. Pretty disappointing.

I had to adhere clear packing tape to the holes where the THIN elastic straps fit through to prevent the holes ripping.  Other than that my 4 year old has been wearing his wings everyday for a week. He loves them more than any toy right now.
summary: My 4 year old LOVES his wings!

reviewText: For some reason I didn't realize that these wings were inflatable when I bought them.  I thought they were hard plastic, so naturally I was impressed by the price.  So when I initially discovered the truth, I was a bit disappointed.  But then I realized how wrong I was.  My three year-old at the time would run against the wall, stair banister, chairs, kitchen island, table, you name it.  If those wings wouldn't have been inflatable, my house would have been destroyed.  They are fantastic!Of course the one problem with inflatable wings is that they can pop.  And our set eventually did.  But it took well over a year of constant wearing and running around for that to happen.  In fact, the elastic straps that go over the shoulders gave out before the wings popped.  I would have never expected this toy to be indestructible, but it lasted much longer than I was expecting, and it didn't hurt my house at all.  Win-win!

We gave this to our son along with the Deluxe Buzz Lightyear costume at Christmas. I inflated the jetpack before wrapping it, and I was nervous it would lose air by Christmas. I am happy to say that, even still, I have not had to add air or re-inflate the jetpack. It's easy for my son to put on and take off himself (he's almost 5) and the elastic straps velcro, so if needed you can undo the velcro instead of sliding the straps over your arms. Although my son often wears his costume without this jetpack, for a price of less than $5, this was a great purchase!

Son wore the product the day we received the entire halloween outfit and sat on the couch and watched toy story wearing it for about 30 minutes...It was so cute!!!!! Tried to blow it up to wear it for halloween and it had a hole in the seam. He wasn't even rough on the jet pack.  Waste of Money!!!!!
My son loves this. We had one before but after a year of being banged around they died, which is acceptable. So we got a replacement for him.
This was a cute accessory but hard to blow up. My son loved them and used to play way after Halloween.
