I know that I can rely on this watch to give me accurate information in these unpredictable mountains.

I've had a Vector for 20 years and have not been able to kill it. Changed the battery many times. Skiing, hiking, trekking, snorkeling, running. It's great. I bought an X-Lander just for the metal case, but if it wasn't around, I'd get another Vector. After all that time, the only things wrong were that the liquid in the face bubble evaporated (it was there until two years ago)and the bezel compass markings have worn a bit.The X-Lander is just very cool looking with the metal case, a better rubber wristband, wider and a better keeper. I think this has taken the Vector's place as my favorite. The functions are identical and I know the settings already.However, THIS IS NOT FOR ACTIVE DUTY PERSONNEL OR ANYONE IN THE FIELD FOR LONG PERIODS. I was in Costa Rica for a week, and used insect repellant daily. The repellant softened the plastic of the battery to the point where the impressed lettering wore away and I could scratch the surface with my fingernail. The rest of the case and the strap were fine. I called Suunto about it and they told me that the manual says not to expose the watch to chemicals. I replied that soldiers and Marines use insect repellant much of the time, and that they should make the cover from Aluminum as they do the case. Apparently, this fell on deaf ears. They are sending me a replacement cover. I noticed in their accessories that they sell replacement covers, which are also available on Amazon here, so this seems to be their solution. But the case and plastic strap were not at all affected, just the battery cover. So, caveat emptor if you're going into jungle with mosquitoes around.My old Vector goes to my daughter.Amazon is my favorite vendor hands down. However, I would look at EMS for this watch. They have a lifetime warranty on their items. If it fails at 10 years, they'll replace it.
summary: Great looking but NOT A MILITARY WATCH.

reviewText: I hope my experience with this particular watch is the exception, but I found absolutely nothing 'military' grade about this watch: The band broke after a few months of VERY light use, and Suunto does not offer a similar band as a replacement, but rather a generic band, taking away quite a bit from the watch's overall appearance. A few months after the band broke, the compass stopped functioning; I'm not sure how sitting on my desk caused the compass to stop working correctly, but there you have it. I have spoken to other Suunto owners who have had the same issue with the compass function.I have owned Casio Pathfinder watches in the past, and they have been FAR superior in regards to both longevity, reliability, and ease of use. My last one survived 5 yrs of hard use (scuba diving, surfing, mountains and deserts...) before giving up the ghost. And it cost about half of what the Suunto cost me. I thought I would try a different brand, but the Suunto survived less than a year of light/no use, no submersion or impacts. I have used Suunto products in the past (compasses) with no problems, but I would not buy another watch from this manufacturer. Hope this helps.

When I first saw this watch, I looked at the price and immediately thought it was over-priced.  But when I saw all the features it had I thought of all the uses I would have for it.  For instance if I wanted to know if the weather was going to turn foul, I could check the barometric readings.  Also I sky-dive quite a bit, and with the watch you can tell your altitude and rate of decent (which believe me is very important), although I still use an actual altimeter instead of the watch you catch my drift.  For those of you who don't sky-dive but do fly, I find it entertaining to ask the flight-attendants what the current altitude is, and correct them when they are wrong, which they are most of the time.  Ok, so what if I am entertained easily, but it still does not take away form the fact that this watch is unquestionably one of the best watches I have ever owned.
summary: The best watch I have ever had

reviewText: I received the watch but with a dead battery.  Changed it out and works just fine.  Don't have the time to complain to company that sold it.
summary: Good watch but arrived with dead battery

reviewText: Even though the manual says "Yes, it is waterproof to a depth of 30 meters (100ft). Rain and other normal exposure to water will not effect its operation.  You can swim wearing your wristop compouter. However, the wristop Computer is NOT a diving device." i dove to a depth of 50 ft (15meters) and my Suunto Yachstsman completely died !!here is what Suunto said:From: Suunto Help Desk <...>Sent: Tuesday, april 10, 2012 19:19Dear Sir/Madam,thank you for contacting Suunto.The Suunto Yachtsman is not a dive product and you shouldn't take it deeper than 2 meters. The watch is water resistant but it's not water proof, this means that you can take a shower with it and swim, but it should never go deeper than 2 meters, also the buttons of the Yachtsman shouldn't be pressed under waterWith best regards,Suunto Help Desk

Suunto X-Lander serial number 99108024.It took over a year, two shipments back to Finland, one at my full expense from New Zealand and at least ten requests by e.mail, to have my watch returned to me, still not repaired fully. And I am certainly not satisfied.Suunto offer Global Support. That, without any exaggeration, means they can receive e.mails from anywhere on the planet you can send one. Unfortunately it means nothing more than that. At all.To the watch itself. A really pleasant surprise from my wife. A great looking watch. That after six to seven days I started to question the clarity of the display. To try keep my complaint down to a short rant, the screen started to fade. The display was sketchy and rapidly worsened. It was winter in Vermont so nothing to do with exposure. Whilst in the UK I arranged for the free courier collection, back to Suunto. The alarm bells sounded when I explained to the courier company what I thought was an unusual request ' collect my watch from my house for repair under warranty' " not a problem sir, we get many of these every day" What?????!The watch was returned and around week six, the screen started to fade again. I contacted "Global Service", but because I was now living in New Zealand they would not pay courier fees. For an unquestioned, faulty watch, still under warranty. Because I was not in the country the watch was purchased in. Which was online, from a store in the USA while my wife was in Antigua. If I may remind you, they took it back from the nearby UK!The e.mails went back and forth, and I kept my cool the entire time. Suunto offered me a new screen. Shipping at my cost. No assurance that it would not happen again. But up until the warranty runs out, I could send back, at my expense, as often as I liked. Well, that wouldn't be so bad. The watch fails on average every four weeks and shipping, repairs and return shipping mean I should only be sending the watch back four or five times a year. 'Well I will tell you what'  write Suunto, ' we will give you a "Core" model watch in exchange'.Let me get this straight, you can't fix my watch with any assurance it will last but you will give me a watch with a lower retail value in exchange, hmmm, tempting? But I have done some research online and about the only thing worse than owning a Suunto X-Lander is owning a Suunto Core! What kind of compensation is that?The e.mails continued and it drew to a head when I wrote that Suunto stop acting in a poor manner and just sort out the watch. I don't want too much, I just want to be able to tell the time while I am wearing it and not holding it up to my face. I failed to mention that if your watch has a very very small viewing angle, your likely in for a disappointment. Suunto said that they would repair my watch and make me happy. That probably only took six months and I have also added a warranty claim for the watch strap splitting on every hole punched in the strap while I have been waiting.The watch was returned. Suunto wouldn't correspond during the two months it took to receive the watch back. And just quietly, I actually hoped that it had been lost in shipping so that I could have the insurance instead. Unfortunately the watch showed up. The screen is a new model. But the watch strap remains split in five places. Suunto won't answer e.mails. Very mature Suunto. If I didn't have a fair warranty claim advise me! Very very childish behavior from a corporation.
summary: Suunto- You should have given better customer service

reviewText: I can't tell you how frustrated I am with this Yachtsman watch.  I sail over 10,000 miles per year on average and really need to have a watch with the features that this Yachtsman provides.  However, I cannot afford to keep replacing watches and bands.I have owned THREE Yachtsman's.  One of these was a warranty replacement.  I have four sailing friends who also bought Yachtsman because I owned one.  Would you believe that all of us have had problems with this crappy watch?My third watch is now dead due to water leakage.  Prior to that I have had the following problems with Yachtsman watches:* Multiple wrist band failures* Sticky buttons* LCD backlight out* Display turned black in sun light* Resetting by itself* Foggy display* Poor customer serviceI have purchased two Sunntos and I PROMISE YOU there will not be a third.
summary: Owned three, never will I own a 4th

reviewText: I owned an X6 model that I loved and used for years...but had to return under warranty for repairs: 1) due to faulty circuit design flaw in original models, 2) then due to repeated failure from 'water intrusion'.  Since I purchased through Eastern Mountain Sports, their 'Unconditional Satisfaction' return policy allowed me to replace failed X6s, um, three times.  But, and reasonably so, after the 3rd failure, EMS said they would only give me credit toward a the Military version of the X-Lander or a final cash refund.  Why the Military version of the X-Lander? Because it is the ONLY Suunto 'Wrist Computer' to feature the same button design as their dive computers. In other words....take any other type of Suunto watch into the wild and you risk losing all functions.Let me be clear: I backpack, I hike, I mountain bike, and I sea kayak...all activities that expose you to water, be it ocean, lake, river, a down pour or three days of drizzle.  I'm careful with my gear. But the non dive button models still crapped out.  SUUNTO even says that their watches are 'Water RESISTANT' to certain depth...but if you press anything while exposed to water (and in my case, twice this was just being out in the mountains in the rain), you are at fault and Suunto will not handle any warranty work.My advice is to buy the X-Lander Military version and learn to deal with its display and programming quirks.And buy from shops that have an Unconditional Satisfaction return policy that extends for quite some time.Sending a watch to Suunto USA for repair takes months and is expensive...and you can roll the dice to guess if they actually worked on your watch.Why buy a Suunto?  Their altimeter & barometer functions are spot on and far easier to calibrate. The watch senses your motion and will re-set between alt and baro functions so that you get an accurate reading (and an alarm) when you NEED one.  Their compass function is also very, very accurate.SUUNTO: get a clue and use DIVE BUTTON DESIGN on all of your wrist computers designed for actual use in the field and not as arm candy.
summary: Top feature is WATER PROOF BUTTONS!!!!!

reviewText: I ordered this watch a few days before New Years Eve as a present to myself and for wearing to President's Club celebration at the Ritz Carlton Resort in South Beach FL and I wanted a watch specifically meant to get wet  without worrying about it being damaged from exposure to the elements.This watch fits comfortably around my wrist. The striking aqua green dial face gets me plenty of comments from folks around the office. The one thing that is kind of odd about this watch, and that is confusing from the get go when you're setting the time initially for the first time, is that it uses the European style of date formatting, DD/MM/YY instead of what we do here in the US, MM/DD/YY.I am not really a sailor but wanted something good looking and different and this watch really fit the bill. If you're looking for an actual sailing watch, from all of the reviews I've read online, you should get this watch as Suunto put a lot into it.If you're like me, and want a fashionable, purposeful watch, then get it too.Hope this helps!

First off the watch looks great and it is a quality product. Smooth alloy, black matt plastic, mineral crystal glass and an excellent band make it an unusual looking watch and it's comfortable to wear. The dial read out is BIG and very clear. Some of the indicators are tiny by comparison but after a while you get used to the layout. Commands via the four buttons are easy once you master the 'tree' of settings. The buttons are not marked on the watch (anywhere) so you need to remember the sequences but again it's not that hard. The temperature read out is not correct when you are wearing the watch (it's about 4c higher) but it quickly moves down when taken off. All the other features appear to work well. I've taken the watch out on my boat and the compass function is great. Took off for a swim (salt water) with no issue. The really cool thing is the back light which has an light green haze to it. In conclusion (and I should say I didn't buy the watch as a serious sail/boat racing tool) I purchased the watch because I liked the look and the features and I'm not disappointed.

This is the 2nd Sunnto yachtsman i have owned (lost the 1st one after several years). For sailboat racing you cannot beat the race timers as well as the compass which allows you to give  a heading to a mark rather than pointing or using clock face postions. The barameter lets you know when things are building or lightening up at a glance.

This is a really good watch. The features are pretty handy - barometer, temperature, can store readings, etc.The only concern is regarding the size of the watch. I gave it to my boyfriend for Christmas and that was the key thing he mentioned - it is really big. So I recommend seeing it beforehand.So if you can live with the size, it's a good buy.

I want to like this watch a lot, but I am having to admit that my inexpensive Timex Ironman (now at the bottom of Lake Michigan ticking away) did the basics better.  The baro and compass features are cool, although I don't use them that much.I find it odd that in "Time" mode it doesn't show the seconds digitally, instead preferring to show the day of week, month, and day of month.  You can get it to show seconds by pressing one of the unlabelled and not particularly intuitive buttons, but only for ten seconds, then it's back to the day (or date, I can't remember which).  I generally want to know seconds, not what month it is, on the race course.  There is a 36 element ring that does some stuff as seconds elapse but it isn't easy to read at a glance.The countdown timer is odd too.  There is no repeat mode, which I used to set to five minutes and just let roll during starting sequences.  Instead there is a one shot timer that, once started, it seems that no force in the universe can reset, although you can get it to jump (either up or down, I can't remember which) by pressing one of the buttons.Finally, I am reasonably intelligent but I'm no good at this thing's interface.  Navigating through functions involves pressing one of three buttons either once, twice in two seconds, or holding it down for two seconds.  There doesn't seem to be much rhyme or reason to when you do what.In all, I'm disappointed with the lack of flexibility for displaying the time (you'd think they could splurge for a six digit display for the time, it is a watch, after all).  The timer is "use it our way or not at all" as well.  I could fight through the interface by reading the manual every night for a week, but really, it's not supposed to be that hard.
My son loves cowboy items and this one did it for him! No issues. Great product.
What as perfect and I might say well made costume! Our theme at work was Witches of Salem and this was perfect.

I have been sailing for some time now and received the watch as a long awaited sailing gift.It is a little big, but I got over that very quickly.  I had the watch for about 9 months and was preparing for an ocean voyage.  I was looking forward to the compass feature.  Two days before the voyage the compass went crazy and has not worked since.The really annoying thing about the watch is the necessity to look "directly" into the face.  If you look at an angle, you might see any array of numbers imaginable, fives are sixes or eighths, and ones become eleven.  The date 9-15 becomes 8-16.  It is really maddening.I admit I haven't been back to the manufacture yet, but these problems should not occur to begin with.Be advised.

I like this watch a lot. Picked this up in order to give my Omega Seamaster a break (needs to be sent back to switzerland to get polished up). This watch is big, but very, very light. At the store where I picked mine up, I had the Seamaster in one hand and the Yachtsman in the other. The Yachtsman has probably twice the mass, but less than half the weight. It is good looking, and will be a conversation piece when worn with a suit at business meetings.The good: Time, stopwatch, barometer, thermometer, compass, and race timer. The race timer is essentially a countdown (you synchronize with race committee gunshots) followed by a stopwatch, with split time viewing and one-race memory. A couple good features: it can only be stopped by hitting the stop button twice in two seconds - good for those of you that wear sailing gloves. Beeps are audible unless the wind is howling above 20 knots. If you aren't a racer, you might do just as well with the x-lander, which excludes the racing timer but includes an altimeter, all within the same aesthetic package. The barometer includes a 1 hour interval memory (remember, 3 mbar change in under an hour and you're probably in trouble) and a thermometer. All units can be changed between imperial and metric. I haven't changed the battery yet but the compartment is opened with a coin, and looks very easy. Also, its a great looking watch if you can pull off the large size, and its relatively inexpensive.The bad: The contrast could be a little darker, and the backlight could be a little brighter. No seconds display on the standard time view. You can toggle seconds display briefly via pushing a button. Reading the manual (twice or three times) is an absolute must, because the buttons are unmarked. The thermometer doesn't take accurate readings while strapped on due to the heat from your wrist. The compass reading is a little jumpy (though in my experience, accurate). Lastly, I already knicked the aluminum bezel reaching into a closet... when I'm rolling around on the foredeck and trimming sails, its probably going to get pretty beat up.Overall, good product. Well done Suunto.
The briefcase is lighter than most leather or nylon briefcases. I like the many compatments and the padded laptop compartment.
I ordered this at the last minute for my 12 year old son for Halloween.  It arrived quickly and in good shape.  Has worn it twice and it has held up well.  Overall, good product for the price!

This bag is perfect for me - I use it for both transport of documents from work to home, and for my position as a lieutenant on a volunteer fire department.  I don't even own a laptop, and the laptop section is great for holding a book or two.
I am very pleased with this product. I have only had it for a few months but it seems to be very well constructed.

This is a very functional piece of luggage, which is good.  It does feel a lot more like "luggage" than a "bag" or "briefcase" though, which is not so good.  I work predominantly in Manhattan, so I am constantly walking around on busy streets, making my way through crowded subways, etc.  The art and science of bag design is a big deal here.  The blocky design of this bag makes it more awkward than a similar bag of a different type.  It does hold a lot of stuff, I can fit my Makita 14.4 volt drill and charger in it, with enough room left over for plans, other hand tools, etc.  The organizer section is a good thing, and useful, though like most other hybrid tool/papers bags, it has some "tool pockets" that fit no tool in my arsenal.  The tape measure pocket works well, keeping me from forgetting one and looking like an idiot when I show up to do an estimate. The clear "plan window" is useless.  If all the relevant drawings for your projects will fit in one 11x14 window, you probably can carry everything else in your pockets.The color is dorky, but it makes you fit into certain client's fantasy of "a guy who knows what he is doing"Some straps that would cinch it up narrower when it wasn't full would be a great addition.It is probably perfect for someone who wants to organize the sea of papers that washes over the front seat of their truck.Three stars is a little low, probably, it is not bad at all, and I do use it, but it is only average, in my opinion.

I love it.  I threw away my old cramped laptop brief-case.  This thing holds everything and room to spare.  I can bring extra drives, batteries, power supply and a large portfolio / planner, folders maps and small tools.  I've been looking for years for a case this versitile that didn't cost over $100.  My only reservation is that it isn't available in Black.  Then again there is no mistake who owns it in a stack of black cases.

This is one of the best shoulder bags I have ever had, I like it a lot. However, my bag has split the sides and the buckle has broken. I have tried repeatedly to get Fiskars, the parent company of Bucket Boss, to fix or replace it attempting contacting them through their consumer "hotline" No one has e-mailed me and there are no other descernable ways to contact the company. Buyer beware ! This bag is defefective and Fiskars has done absolutely nothing to help.I hate to complain but the manufacturer of this product has majorly dropped the ball.
summary: This is a good product, but Fiskar's customer service stinks

reviewText: This is an OK briefcase.  But the one you receive after ordering it may NOT be the model depicted.  The model represented on Amazon is the 'Bucket Boss 06092 EA01 Pro Contractors Briefcase' with the clear map pocket.  The model I received was the 'Bucket Boss Classic 06092 (no EA01) Pro Contractors Briefcase' which isn't as nice -- it doesn't include the map pocket.  After waiting weeks for delivery -- NOT satisfied.

I got this as a gift to replace a hard side brief case that was falling apart. It is deceivingly large. 7 pockets plus places to carry pens, calculator, and miscellaneous. Large padded center area to carry a 17" laptop. you can even get a small change of clothes in one pocket. if you need to. For a brief case it lacks some in design, I would like to see a better design for storage, for files, paper calculator, pens, ruler, and other things most contractors carry. This is still better than most of the laptop cases out there. It is very well built as are other Bucket Boss products.

The briefcase is made of quality materials and very durable. It has plenty of compartments for my files and folders as well as my laptop. I especially like the accessibility to the section that can hold small tools.

I purchased a new contractor's briefcase in January 2012 to replace the one I purchased back in 1999, which had finally started to show wear in the stitching. I was extremely happy with my previous briefcase; it lasted longer than I expected. Already, my new one has seams splitting in THREE places! I had to replace the strap with the one from my previous briefcase because it immediately started fraying. I doubt I will use my new one for more than a few months -- it just seems cheap and unreliable.With a "quality" product such as this I expected there would be some sort of replacement guarantee. In fact, Bucket Boss has almost no internet presence, and only a toll-free number. Calling the number allows you to leave a message, which is never answered (it has been a month since I called).Considering Bucket Boss' former quality, I'm very disappointed.
This is one of the most funtional, durable, and versitile briefcases I've ever owned. Its well made and has a ton of space to store your things. I highly recommend it.

I ride the train to work, and needed something to carry mags and other various things.  I look at it this way, if I'm going to carry a purse, it should say bucket boss on it.This is my second one,  the first was great.  This one has two extra pockets over and above the last one.  One of the pockets could carry a laptop  computer.  Overall I really like this one.if ya gotta carry a purse, this is the one!
Don't buy. This bag is overpriced, you can just run to your local Home Depot and pick it up for $45.

My husband is really enjoying the new briefcase.  he had an old one he wouldn't give up.  When it sat it down on the floor it would collapse like a bean bag filled with water.Now with the new case, there is a pocket for everything.  He doesn't carry a laptop so the center padded laptop holds his valuable things.My husband runs a business very well, but organized he is not.  However I am amazed at how organized he is keeping this bag or how organized the bag is keeping him.  I'm not sure which but it is loaded and stands up straight and tall where ever he leaves it and that is much easier to take than his old one.

I purchased this, my second Bucket Boss briefcase, after my first BB Briefcase wore out. I was very pleased with the first one and it was tough as nails.Imagine my disappointment to find its replacement was a cheaply-made, crappier, and more expensive version of the original. The damn fastener (seen above in the photo in the middle of the case) didn’t work! It wouldn’t latch. I had to remove the fastener from my original BB briefcase and have it sewn on at a shoe repair place.Replacing the leather “Bucket Boss” logo was a crappy plastic one. Missing from the new briefcase was the snap hook with webbing and a snap to easily remove it from the briefcase. That was a really handy feature for managing keys. The carrying strap is no longer adjustable and the sturdy clips that once affixed the strap to the briefcase have been replaced with the chintziest, crappiest clips that I’m sure BB could find. I am confident they will break in no time.This will be my last Bucket Boss purchase. I’ve removed the Bucket Boss logo from the briefcase because I no longer want to provide free advertising for them. Accountants. Bean Counters.  They are responsible for the demise of every good product.

I really like this well designed bag, its large enough to carry notebooks, books and plenty of office related stuff while out and about. Unfortunately, I really DISLIKE the tear in the fabric that has developed on the side, adjacent to the shoulder strap. Not unlike another customer who has reviewed it, I also have sent a couple of emails to Bucket Boss Brand for information on repair or replacement and have yet to hear a word. So, although a great bag in design and function, I suspect that the material quality and workmanship is sub par and would advise consumers to find an alternate product. Surprisingly, I really do not mind the fact that the bag has developed a defect, of all the Bucket Boss products I have purchased over the years this is the first one that has let me down. What really torques my jaw is that Bucket Boss Brand no longer seems to care about their loyal customers or product quality.
summary: Nice Bag, Nice Rip, Poor customer service!

reviewText: I have used this bag daily for 5 years, schlepping tools and documents from one job to another. Very well constructed with many nice features. I would buy it again.

I first bought one of these bags in 2001 for my husband who is a real estate inspector. He carried his laptop, printer, digital camera, paperwork, pens, small tools, etc. in the Bucket Boss. Never a thread pulled or a handle torn. And this bag was LOADED down.In early July of this year, he was in Dallas and his car was broken into during the night. His Bucket Boss bag and everything in it was stolen. Sure, he was sick about losing the electronics. But what was really upsetting to him was losing his awesome bag!!! It was like losing a limb.We were able to replace the computer, printer and digital camera (fortunately the thieves threw all of the paperwork from the bag in the alley so at least that material was recovered).  But what about the Boss?Men are such creatures of habit. My husband knew what every little pocket, zippered compartment, and latched closure contained. All at his fingertips. Now it was gone. What to do?After much searching, I found the Bucket Boss here on Amazon!  Purchasing it was kind of like Christmas.  I did not tell my husband I had found another Boss until it arrived. When he opened it, it truly WAS Christmas for him!!We both HIGHLY recommend this product.

This is easily the most functional, durable, practical briefcase I've ever owned (and I've owned more than my share).  It has ample space, and adequate padding for a laptop.  It has perfect pockets for PDAs and cell phones, in addition to other general nooks and crannies.  My two favorite features are 1) the weight. it is extremely light, considering that it has laptop padding and side stiffeners to make it stand up unassisted. 2) the color.  Why does all luggage have to be black?  Americans are such dreary conformists.

I bought a Bucket Boss Contractors Briefcase years ago at Home Depot for my son in law who had a used car business. Prior to this he had used expensive leather briefcases. However once he used the Bucket Boss Briefcase he sold all of his fancy leather ones at a yard sale. When the that one finally wore out after many years of service he went looking for another and couldn't find one - Home Depot no longer carried them - I found exactly what he needed on Amazon. That was three years ago and he is totally delighted with it just as he was the first. He said not only was it the sturdiest bag he ever had but it gave him a briefcase as well as a tool box to boot. He says it totally blows away everything else he has ever used.

Fabulous. Only three detail items remain:1. Shoulder strap should be adjustable (it isn't);2. Plastic flap-closure snap connector needs more clear strap distance so that it can be tightened when bag is near empty. Flap is always loose as a result.3. Plastic flap-closure snap connector hard on arthritic fingers: too much push required.Otherwise, everything you would want in a work bag.

This is just the kind of briefcase/bag I've been searching for. For years, I've used knapsack style bags and had everything thrown into the one hole. This Bucket Boss Briefcase is organized and tough as nails, while still looking very professional. Thanks
summary: Best briefcase I've had in years

reviewText: My office at a well known Cellular Network office, we all have laptops that we carry to and from work daily. I bought this back in March. Nobody has one that looks like this. Never any question about whose this belongs to. It is strong, well made, roomy, and has pockets and slots for just about everything from an emergency flashlight, extra cell phone, UMTS hot spot, cables, power supply, mouse, extra (small) keyboard, mouse pad. All of it. Really glad I got this model.

I got tired of lugging a bookbag around with my stuff crammed in it.  My leather breifcase can't handle the dust  and tough conditions of a worksite. I feel secure putting my lap top in this.  I wish the pockets in the front were a little bigger so that I could put my calculator in.  And I wish the document pocket had plastic on both sides so that I would feel that there was one waterproof pocket.
This came on time and in great shape. The child was very happy with it. Thank You for a great experience.

I wanted a non-leather soft brief case (canvas or synthetic material)in which I could carry my work stuff both to & from work/home and on a plane for business travel.  So it has to be organizable, capable of carrying a lot and comfortable to lug around. And also secure to not loose things.  I don't use this bag for tools but rather for papers, small lap top, computer stuff, phone charger & other personal stuff.Although I would have prefered a canvas material, I couldn't find a big enough one so I purchased this brand.  Turns out, I like it a lot & I would definately buy another if & when this one wears out -which near as I can tell won't be in the near future -seems like it will last.

great product - will buy more soonIt was by accident that I found this product and am happy happy.  Tried many others before they were either too big  or too small but these are true to size and fit just "right and left"

Inspectors love being able to pack it full of office supplies, pens, calculators, etc. AND have the ability to swallow the 2008 NEC code books, clip boards, permit cases etc.  Flexible fabric avoids bulging blowouts that hard cases can't handle.  Rough and tough so far.
summary: Great for hauling Clipboard and codebooks for inspector

reviewText: this item saved me 90 bucks each  pairas I need some special support sock. I got some from a local store and they cost me over 100.00 each pair and were a funny tan color. I got these at costco and loved them when I went to reorder they had discontinued them I found the at Amazon at the same price and much faster shippingthanks

I'm recovering from DVT and  have a lot of trouble getting American size clothing in Japan. The medical supply companies here have only S & M sizes and only white with open toes. Since everybody goes without shoes indoors, I had two problems.  This is the second order of these socks I've gotten from Amazon. Repeat spells satisfaction for me.  4 stars?  They pick up too much lint from the floors (no shoes, remember?)  Also, I'd like a heavier weight for the cold winters here. Wooden floors, no shoes, no central heating in classrooms. How about that price? Size apart, the price of the socks and international postage is still cheaper.
i find these to be a great benefit to me. they help control the swelling of my ankles due to surgery.i recommend these . they may not help everybody but they sure helped me.
I like 'em.  They do just what they say they're going to do.  That's all you can ask.

My title says it all.  I can wear the sox all day without getting the feeling that I'm being squeezed to death.  Compression is even with no binding, especially at the top of the sock where some surgical sox compress too hard.  They wash up great and seem to be holding up well after a couple of washings.  Best thing was the price -- at $9.99 a pair, you can't go wrong.

I bought these hoping they would be a help with my giant swollen pregnant ankles and they certainly were I just don't like them as much as I liked the socks from the same brand. They are great as far as staying up and do relieve your legs as much as can be expected from a knee high.
summary: Bought for my pregnant swollen ankles

reviewText: I've ordered these before and they are quite helpful and recommended by a nurse at the hospital to me on my last visit.
This is a very nice support stocking.  It has enough support to stop swelling and doesn't look like a support knee high.  The top of the stocking is not tight like many others are.
summary: Works very well for just enough support.

reviewText: Great item...really does improve the blood flow in my legs...so that I can almost bounce off the walls again.
It was a gift and has been praised highly by the recipient.  The product exceeded my expectations.
summary: Top Rated Knee Highs purchased thru Amazon

reviewText: I've been wearing this brand of support knee highs for years & have found them more & more difficult to come by in the brick & mortar stores. I was so relieved & pleasantly surprised to find them on amazon @ a much lower price & free shipping!!!! As a nurse I am on my feet for long hours & it's great to know that when I take these knee highs off, shower & finally go to bed my legs aren't still "running". I can actually relax!  YAY!!!!
On long trips,  (air car, bus) I take precautions (asprin) and wear these to reduce the possibility of DVT.These are comfortable, fit well, hand laundered nicely and are good value.
These are the best support stockings.  I'm able to wear all day without a problem.

This is exactly what I needed since I'm on my feet over 12 hours every day. It is more supportive than the hoses you can purchase at a regular department store and it doesn't cost that much more. It is pretty dressy to wear under casual pants and does not make me feel too hot and uncomfortable in the summer months. It also helps control the edema in my ankle and helps with my varicose veins as well. I strongly recommend this for others who are on their feet all day.

I bought a pair of these a month ago and found them to be comfortable yet provide enough support to reduce swelling in my ankles and feet.  This time I bought two more pair so I always have an extra pair available.

On the advise of the vein clinic and physicians, I am to wear light compression knee highs under dress slacks to help with fatigued legs from osteoarthritis and fibromyalgia.  These work great but I ordered beige and they sent me nude.  If it weren't for that, they would get my 5 stars!!!!
summary: These are perfect to wear under dress slacks!

reviewText: Very comfortable compression knee highs. Very good for leg circulation.  Easier to put on the leg than some other brands.

I wish they had more compression. They still provided some but not enough for me. I have thin calves and I do have to pull then up a couple times throughout my shift. I still wear them but I have another pair I like better.

October 2011:  Ok, editing my review now that I know what size to order... Love Futuro Mild Compression Knee Highs!March 2011:  To all you would-be buyers...  SMALL is U.S. shoe size 4-5; MEDIUM, 5.5-7.5; and LARGE, 8-10.5.  The only reason I am giving this product 3 stars is due to poor advertising/product description.  I would love to try out my new Futuro Energizing knee highs -- it came in today -- but it is the wrong size!  The only size options one gets when ordering are small, medium, and large and no where in the product description, product picture (I even tried zooming in on it), etc., does it mention anything about shoe sizes.  Frustrating!  Perhaps I will change my rating after I exchange what I have for the right size.
summary: Small, medium, large...what are the shoe sizes?

reviewText: I purchased this for my husband and am very happy with the product. I was a little worried about the size because of a previous review saying that it was too small to get over his head but this was not a problem and my husband does not have a small head.
This is not meant to fit on a man, granted I'm a big guy but it won't even fit over my head. Go ahead and buy it if you're tiny
summary: Way to small for a man

reviewText: I bought two of these, they fit over my adult head just fine and I've been wearing one for a couple of months with no issues.  For an inexpensive Diabetic ID, this is a good deal!
It was just what it said it was. I am very satisfied and would recommend this very affordable medical necklace.
I bought this to wear when i don't wear the bracelet.  It is perfect to wear under a blouse or top.  It is just the right length.

The necklace is a good length. Just what I was looking for and a great price. The chain does tend to get caught and snag on your wash cloth in the shower. But it is great for someone who doesn't want a bracelet broadcasting that you are a diabetic. The word diabetic is engraved on the charm. Good product I would buy again. It takes awhile to get to you, so be patient.
This little travel wipes case makes a great baby shower gift!  It is the perfect size to fit until a diaper bag and you can refill it with more wipes whenever you need to.
I bought this necklace and am very satisfied with it.  It fits over my head okay and seems to be the right lengthdown on my chest. I'm 6'3" and weigh 170 lbs.  It does and is what it says.Brian
I purchased these to spice up the diaper bag! Love that they are reusable and keep wipes moist. I got 3 and now they are all frilly!
summary: Perfect for decorating and Re use!

reviewText: The case is sturdy, functional, fits in a medium / large purse. The wipes are papery, weak, and they tear if you pull them too fast from the small door. My suggestion is to buy the case, throw out the wipes, and use your own. I like Up&Up from Target.

Huggies Baby Wipes Travel Casehttp://www.amazon.com/Huggies-Natural-Care-Wipes-Unscented/dp/B0000535SI/ref=wl_it_dp_o_pC_nS_nC?ie=UTF8&colid;=3RLU5D1NTWGFL&coliid;=I39W4EA9OGVS03I love this case because it's rigid so it's easy to find, or slide into a pocket.  It's a one hand operation, similar to the regular size boxes.  I like the wipes too, but you can refill it easily with whatever wipes you like.  I just take some out of the big box that I keep at home.  And for price / shipping - - just put it in your wish list.  Then when you buy something else, add this to bump up the price so you get free super saver shipping.

I originally bought these for use in diaper changes. I was so amazed that there was no scent at all that i have started using them myself! I have severe allergies to perfumes and have been left very few choices as far as wipes for day to day mishaps( there is always something with 2 kids -ketchup to peanut butter).Now we never leave home without them.
summary: great product for those with allergies/sensative skin

reviewText: This is a handly little item to carry in your diaper bag and I am sure I will put it to use once the baby is born. The shipping however was too high for such a small, lightweight item.
summary: just what I was looking for

reviewText: I bought this for my friend as a gift and she says she loves it. Its perfect when you don't want to take the big container everywhere you go.

These wipes are just wonderful.  You need a few of them to stash around for when you need a moist wipe in a hurry.  I had one in the car glovebox, in the diaper bag, and on each floor in addition to my wipe warmer.  The package is just the right size to have for the "just in cases" that always seem to come up.  These make wonderful shower gifts since you can reuse them over and over again with the refillable packages.  They are great life savers and keep you have having to run all over the house looking for a wipe for emergencies.  Gotta love that!  Once the diaper stage is over, keep one in your purse for wiping up after meals out, days at the park, etc.  Great product idea!
Love these. So compact. Keep the wipes dry. But they are only $1.49 each at BRU, so buy them there...way better value :)
summary: Awesome! But buy them at Babys R Us

reviewText: Huggies makes the best wipes!  They are nice and thick and just moist enough to do their job without leaving my baby's bottom soaked and prone to a rash.  I love the case too.  It stays closed much better than the Pampers travel case.

I bought this so i could have a refillable wipes case in my diaper bag that didn't take up a lot of room, and just couldn't justify spending $20 on one that had been decorated already. (Especially since they are all these underneath the fabric) It has worked great and i haven't had to worry about it getting soiled as it just wipes off!

My children are far apart in age, but with my first I loved having this travel case to go in the diaper bag.  I really wanted one again for this baby but I couldn't find them in an of the stores I looked at, so I ordered this one.  However, I have to keep this one closed with a rubber band.  Since I paid almost five dollars for this I expected it to function correctly. Very disappointed.

I wanted this for my diaper bag and thought I'd be able to find this in the grocery store or WalMart, but had no luck, so I ordered this from Amazon. It is the perfect travel size, is refillable, and has the popup lid for easy access. Stays closed without problem.

This is the only travel wipes dispenser I've been able to find that can both 1)be re-filled from a standard baby wipes package AND 2)can dispense a single wipe at a time. I don't even like the wipes. They have chemicals in them that I don't want to use on my baby's skin. But the box is the best travel wipes case I've ever seen! It retains the moisture inside the case nicely too.
I was not aware that they sold this at Walmart, Walgreens, and CVS and places of like that. I would have bought it there instead, but the product itself is great. :)
Happy and satisfied with my purchase what I most like is I can use the case again I just refill it with more wipes. I should also mention it was delivered fast.

I don't get it, the soft pack travel wipes have 30-40 wipes. This hard pack only has 16 wipes. For the same price with the soft package you get 2x as many wipes. I don't think 16 wipes is enough to even get through the day if you're traveling.These are soft flexible wipes that won't get damaged, why do they need to be in a hard case anyway? The soft pack will hold them just fine and takes up less space. Plus with a soft pack you can feel how many wipes are left by squeezing it.It seems to be that this is a product where you are just paying for packaging and not product. Some executive needed to come up with a new product to sell and this was the junk he came up with. It's a complete waste of money and in no way functional.
I was very unhappy with the quality of these wipes.  They are a nice thickness but far too dry.  I would not recommend the wipes at all.

So I bought some of the more expensive (empty) cases to make baby shower gifts. You know those cute padded fabric wipes cases? Turns out that these Huggies containers are a lot more durable. So spending less than $5 on all materials is an epic win.
summary: Perfect for making a cheap boutique-style baby gift

reviewText: We only use Huggies sensitive wipes for our son, because they are alcohol free and they are also thick and stay moist.  This travel case is good for diaper bags and the pop-up dispenser works well.

I had to replace my first (generic) wipes container because the clasp broke on it. I bought this Huggies brand container and absolutely LOVE it! The one I had previously opened like a wallet, which made it difficult to grab one wipe at a time with one hand while trying to hold my squirming baby with the other. This container has a smaller opening on top (like a regular container, or a kleenex box) so that only one will come out a time. It is a lot more durable than my previous one, too! I was happy to spend a little more money on a name-brand container to make sure that I wouldn't have to replace it after a few months.

I love huggies wipes (because they are nice and thick)  and I love this holder.My previous travel case lasted almost 3 years.  I like it because I can refill it as needed, and take it with me in my purse, everywhere I go.I like this product  better than the disposable travel packs because: the disposable pouches get all smashed up in my bag and look ugly, the sticky seal at some point stops sticking closed and the wipes inside dry out, they are not refillable.You need this!
I've bought this a few times because ,y husband and I lose them often. Worth it and better than the others ones that I've tried.

The performances are true to the origional composer's intent.  It never sounds like the music is being distorted to fit on a harmonica.  Rather, it sounds the as if the music were written for harmonica.
Most diaper bags are not with an easy-to-go wipes case. You can have it in your diaper bag with a cheap price!

Hey as far as video game shirts go this one is really nice, you can't really see it in the picture but the "squee" character on the back is kind of sketchy and hand drawnish, and yet very lively and colorful...any how this is a nice shirt.....I would'nt wear it on a date or anything but if you are a MYST fan (and you must be if you took the time to read all this gobbly gook) it is an absolute must have, I must also recomend the sound tracks and of course the games.....oh and the books kick butt also.
summary: One heck of a swell shirt

reviewText: Amazing purchase and super fast shipping! This hat was so much better than I expected!!! I actually purchased it for myself and with the flex fit, it was absolutely perfect! I LOVE it!

This was a great hat. We bought it for a Harry Potter Halloween costume. It is wonderful quality. The hat is sturdy and stays standing. It has an adjustable ban made of cloth to adjust the fit. This was shoved in a bag and still came out standing tall and we received so many comments on the hat since they were not in the stores!
I just couldn't believe the quality of this item.  It's well made and realistic looking.  Everyone who sees it wants to know where I got it.  Great value.
Great item for the price. and just like in the movie, my niece, adored it.She loves Harry Potter, and this made her day.

Thank goodness this hat was available!  The high quality look and feel of this hat makes the whole Harry Potter look for my son, he loves it and so does everyone else!  This hat is worth every penny.  The hat is one size, but will fit any child's head, because it has an elastic/velcro seizer on the inside of the hat.  This is one of the best purchases I have ever made online.

This Hogwart's student hat by Elope is really terrific.  It's velvety, solid, and can stand on it's own.  But better yet: It's perfect for wearing.  When the ridiculous clowns in charge of the company I work for decided to change the annual Christmas Party to a more inclusive and cuddly, Holiday Party I decided to have a little fun.  This Hogwart's cap and the cape I wore last Halloween (I was Draculove) made for a winning combo and was in solid contrast to the more staid semi-formal attire the others were wearing.  The adjustable head strap allowed the hat to fit snuggly on my noggin and it refused to fall off despite numerous attempts by less understanding party goers (and even one very angry, tipsy bossman).  I was even able to slip a couple of phone numbers into the secret pocket inside the cap.  I didn't realize how many hostesses were fans of Harry Potter, but now I know.  And you will too if you purchase this fine hat.
It's just a hat. Harry Potter is the kid's things, and it made them smile. So good for me, and that's all that I really need to know. But it doesn't wow me.

Although my granddaughter is a fan of Harry Potter, that is not why we got this hat. We are going to use it as Alfaba's hat from Wicked. She is going to be her on Halloween. This hat is theater costume quality and perfect for the costume. It's a large hat and would easily fit an adult. Which is perfect as my seven year old has tons of hair and it fits great.

.Very enthusiastic about Balakirev's work--especially his unique and fascinating piano art-music.Balakirev posessed incredible imagination and creativity, plus astounding personal piano technique.Practically self-taught, he is utterly original in both style and content: withal, his music is extremely challenging to perform and thereby infrequently heard--which is a pity, for it is rich art of complex beauty.Looking at the map: with the Berlin-Vienna axis as the center of the 19th Century musical universe, St. Petersburg and Mosko are equidistant as Brussels and Paris.  Point being that Chopin and Balakirev are in the same orbit as Franck and Fauré.  And they all share a penchant for large piano pieces in the stylized genres of nocturne, waltz, scherzo, mazurka, fantasy and the like.  Balakirev's music is surely no less cosmopolitian than Franck's; and like Chopin, Fauré, and Scriabin, Balakirev favours unusual key-colours with many sharps or flats.Balakirev may perhaps be considered as a synthesis of Chopin and Scriabin.Malcolm Binns is an eclectic artist who has made Balakirev something of a specialty.For this recital, Binns presents a good selection of Balakirev's significant and representative works.Featured here are two of Balakirev's three Scherzi--No. 2 in bb-minor (1900) and No. 3 in f#-minor (1901), each very sophisticated of ~:07mins duration.The very lyrical 7th Mazurka in the remote key of eb-minor is ~:08mins of choice salon art-nouveau.The great bb-minor Sonata (1905) of 1/2hour's duration is Balakirev's most significant piano work after the brilliantly twisted Oriental Fantasy, Islamey (Db-major, ~:08mins duration).The Sonata is comprised of four movements:I): Andantino--descriptive Russian polyphony;II): Mazurka--a transcription of his 5th Mazurka;III): Intermezzo--lyrical Jugendstil;IV): Allegro--bravura tour de force featuring the Trepak.This satisfying programme is interspersed with three charming character pieces: the Gondolied, the Berceuse, and the Lark.See too:Balakirev: Piano Music (Complete) [Box Set]Balakirev: Piano Music (Complete) [Box Set]Balakirev and Mussorgsky: Piano MusicBalakirev and Russian FolksongBalakirev: Symphony No. 1; Islamey; TamaraBalakirev: Symphony No. 2; RussiaBalakirev: Piano Concertos No. 1 in F-Sharp Minor and No. 2 in E-Flat Major / Rimsky-Korsakov: Piano Concerto in C-Sharp MinorRussian Piano MusicMily Alexeyevich Balakirev: Piano Music, Volume 1Balakirev: Piano Music.
I BOUGHT THIS BIRTHDAY CAKE HAT FOR MY SONS FIRST BIRTHDAY, I  HAD HIS PICTURE TAKEN WITH IT ON AND PUT THE PICTURE ON HIS BIRTHDAY INVITATIONS TO HIS 1ST BIRTHDAY. HOW ADORABLE HE LOOKED.
had grandma embroider birthday boys name on the side...wish it had more room to grow.  but still like it.  perfect for pictures.
My Son does have a big head; but this was really really small and we were not  able to use it.

my son got this as a gift for his first birthday.  He's great at wearing hats and didn't mind wearing it.  I was afraid it might not fit, he's a big boy with a big head.. but it did, you can stretch it a little.Everyone at his party (the adults) thought it was great.  Got cake all over it, but we'll need a bigger one for next year anyway!

Somehow I was expecting a full costume instead of just a hat.  Maybe because it appeared along with the other Halloween costume Amazon was selling.  The description never said it was just a hat, how about saying "Toddler B-day Cake Hat".  Anyway, we still had a little laugh after getting over the fact "it's just a hat."
Easy Clips That You Can Do While 1/2 A Sleep, Soft, A Little Tight Going On, But That Just Keeps Every Thing In Place.

I saw this nusing  bra  and thought I would give it a go.  I love it!!!  It is the most comfortable bra I have worn yet.  It is soft and does not bind and best of all it does not dig into my shoulders.  It fits like a sports bra but is better and far more comfortable.  This is  well worht 30.00 in my book.  I am  going to  buy several more!!

I bought several different kinds of nursing bras before my baby was born including this one.  This is the only one I still wear.  Traditional nursing bras are uncomfortable and obvious under clothes.  I bought larger sizes of my favorite bra and wear those when I go out.  I sleep in the Medela bra and wear it around the house.  I am quite large breasted, and I find they have plenty of support.  I even do low-impact aerobics in it.  It is worth every penny.
summary: The only nursing bra I still wear!

reviewText: All of Medela products (nursing pads, lanolin, bras, pumps, etc...) are definitely the best that I've tried (and I've tried most all mainstream brands).This bra in particular is EXTREMELY comfortable on sore nipples.  I have sensitive skin and nipples and I found this to be the best there is (Bravado was too rough for me as were some other night nursing bras I tried).  The material is sort of a pantyhose type of material where when you slip it on, it feels as though there's nothing there but it protects and supports your sensitive breasts (especially important during the first several weeks of first time nursing).  It's not really a bra that you'd want to wear on an evening out as it's more of a sports type bra and it would not support adequately for high impact activities (like aerobics, etc...) but it's perfect for around the house or errand running or low impact activities such as yoga.  As a larger breasted women (especially breast feeding - I went from a 36DD to a 36G), this bra works perfectly for me for support and comfort.  It's a MUST HAVE for anyone who is breastfeeding.
summary: The Best Nursing Bra by Far - a MUST HAVE

reviewText: I got this bra when I was pregnant and wore it confortable until my delivery.  After my delivery the bra was too small.  With the engorged breast after delivery and just carrying mature milk afterwards it is just too small.  I wasn't told that my breast would get even larger after delivery.  I thought they were big just before delivery.I decided to go w/ bravado bra.  It has worked out much better.  It is comfortable to wear day and night. And as the milk comes in and out it is comfortable either way.  The sizes are more flexable then medela.  The strap support is better then medela.I have packed up the medela bras and will just use them during pregnancy if i have another.  No use for them when i am not pregnant or for breastfeeding.  And breastfeeding is their main purpose.

My 3-1/2 year old grandson is crazy about this costume.  He wanted to wear it home so I let him and ordered another one for my house.  The first thing he wants to do when he comes to Gramma's house is put on his police uniform.  It is very well made and because it is made to grow with your child, you will definitely get years of wear out of it (and not just for Halloween - this is a year round fantasy play outfit)
My grandson is having so much fun dressing up as a Fireman.  He especially likes the fire hose and accessories that came along with the outfit.
My 5 year old loves to pretend and this has kept him entertained for hours.  It seems fairly durable but he hasn't had it that long.

We ordered this costume for my three-year old's birthday, to his great delight on opening it. I'm pleased to see that it will probably fit him for several more years. The quality of the coat itself is very nice, the adjustable hat is great, and my boy loves the "fire extinguisher" that squirts real water. My only complaint is that the coat closures, which are sort of a spring-loaded hook-and-eye design, are very poorly made and were all broken within 24 hours after my son received his gift. (This was with an adult doing all of the fastening and unfastening!) Now, we can still use the jacket, since the springs (which popped out) merely made the closures "lock," and the eyes will still sit in the hooks and keep the jacket closed. But I was disappointed by this one inconsistency in the quality of this purchase.
summary: Great Costume That Needs One Adjustment

reviewText: I ordered this for our grandson who is 3 for Christmas. I also got him the Tonka fire truck. He just loves wearing it & playing firefighter. It is really cute & the red color is perfect. Fits him well with room to grow. It was one of his favorite presents.Would definitely recommend this for small children
Great for dress up.  I got this for my niece as a gift.  She loved it.  The spray bottle was her favorite part.
Did the job and was most economical choice available. Shipping was super fast and got to us in 2 days as promised.  Only one problem was the first time it was used the bow tie came apart.

This Bunny Hunny! was loved by all the children and even the adults, It fit like a glove on women and man up to size 22 ( women) and 46(man)....I would recommend it for any Easter celebration and it arrived in a very timely manner.

this costume was a hit at our easter event we had. we had a huge neighborhood easter egg hunt and my friend dressed up and danced around all day. it was great...just a little warm if you live in arizona but other than that awesome!!!

Our civic association purchased this for our annual Easter fest.  We were looking more at price than overall effect, and now I am searching for a replacement. The most common comment from the kids is the face is a little scary.  Looking for a cuter more cuddly effect.  This one also does not cover the back of the neck and the red cords that tie the costume at the back are conspicuous. I would not recommend this one. Spend a little more and get something that will make you very happy year after year.

The Easter Bunny SUit was a hit with most of the kids older than 5 years of age. The babies meaning, ages between 1-2 years old were a little scared of the bunny. The eyes looks like the bunny is angry or something. It could of been made to look a little more friendly. Suit was ok for price you pay, would recommend better materials for the actual suit and to make more coverage with the back of the neck.

I ordered the easter bunny costume to surprise my grandson and the mask is damaged. I am sooooo disappointed! The mouth of the mask has the white paint missing and it was damp when delivered so it looks like someone noticed the defect and tried to fix it. There is also paint missing near the left eye and the fur near the right eye is hard and matted. The outside packaging was fine but the inside original package was damaged and it looks like this may have been a previously returned product. I don't have time to return the costume since I need it for Sunday so I'm going to have to try to fix it myself. I feel like I got ripped off especially after I paid the extra shipping cost for express shipping! I feel that someone noticed the defects but because it was being mailed....who cares? Can you imagine the let down when I came home from work so excited that the costume arrived a day early only to open it and find it damaged? Unfortunately there is absolutely nothing you can do to rectify the situation since Easter is only 3 days away. This may be only a costume to you but to me its a lifetime memory for my grandson. How sad that your company didn't care about service. The most inportant thing about sales is service and you can't have one without the otherAfter writting the above review I received an email telling me that they were going to overnight another costume and they sent me a free return shipping label. I didn't mail the costume back right away because I didn't trust they would stand by their word but I was wrong! I received the new costume on Friday and it was perfect! Thank you so much for correcting the situation the way you did! It means so much to me and my family. My grandson was so surprised and he said "I can't believe I met the real live Easter Bunny" His memory was made....THANK YOU! I told everyone about your outstanding service and would absolutley do business with this company anytime. If anyone out there is looking for top notch service then you have found your place! I'll see you folks for the next memory making holiday and thank you again for all you did to make this easter a memory for my precious grandson!Rose

I am very pleased with the quality of this costume. I haven't used it yet, but it appears to be very well made and it should last for years. My only caution would be to watch the eyes. The mesh fabric which covers them can come unglued if you bend the mask - but it's a very simple fix if that happens. Just be sure to wait for the glue to dry and the fumes to subside before you put the head back on!

Looks cool but the plastic is very thin on the chest shield, leg and arm guards. The face plate velcroes on as does the shoulder pads which pop off too easily! Every move my son made they were coming apart! Too many pieces for an active boy to keep in place for any length of time! This costume is cheaply made for the price!We were very disappointed in it!!!
I wanted an inexpensive mask to display so I can't review its durability. It looks real and displays nice on my shelf with my Darth Vader Mask.

Overall, this is a neat costume for the money and my son thinks it's pretty cool. I think there are 2 things that could have been done differently though:1. The shoulder pads fall off easily as they need to make either more velcro to hold them on or else find a different way to attach the shoulder pads (which I'm in the process of doing).2. My son was pretty disappointed that the sword pictured didn't come with the costume. For their cost of an extra buck at the most, the company should really have the matching sword included.So really, these are minor things that can be fixed and the costume is really neat and also fun for kids to play with, but sometimes it's nice to buy something without having to "fix" it :)

My son received this costume for his 4th birthday.  It's absolutely not worth [...].  Very cheaply constructed and the mask doesn't fit properly. It also runs very small.  My son wears a 3T and this costume sized 4-6 fit him perfectly.  Look elswhere for a spiderman costume; it can't be worse than this one.

"My son loved his costume he is very exited to use it, the mask fits him very well, so I have no complaints & its sold here for half the price than other places, & that makes happy!" -- Update He wore his costume three times and it still going. The mask was ok, but you do need a bigger size but very Happy over all.
This was for my grandson for Halloween and he loved it.  He is a huge spider man fan.  He look great in it.
I don't recomend this product, because the low quality. In the first week the product deteriorated. Unfornatelly I don't liked.

Was very disappointed in this costume.  Admittedly, only find a problem with one aspect - so far.  But if you show me a picture of what the product looks like...  THEN THAT IS WHAT IT SHOULD BE!!!!!  The mask on the toddler size of this costume is only half a mask.  It is a cap of sorts with pieces that hang down over the eyes.  It does not cover the face or ears!!Would never have chosen this costume if the correct picture had been shown!

I Love This Pack!, April 17, 2002As a college student this year, I needed a pack that wouldn't let me down. My old one was already getting kind of worn and I needed one that would last me through all four years. Alas, the Big Student is exactly that kind of pack. It is big, rugged, and well organized with lots of pockets and compartments to hold all of your stuff.The pack is divided into two main compartments. The bigger one is very roomy and that's where I keep all of my binders and my textbooks, while the smaller one is where I keep my spiral notebooks, organizers, and datebooks. There is also a compartment sewn onto the smaller compartment and is where I keep my tissues and other knick knacks.The two smaller pockets on the front are wonderful! I don't know where I would be without them! The smaller one has lots of small pockets on the inside, where I can store all of my pens, pencils, and other supplies. There's even a cell phone pocket and a keyper, a key loop, for all of your keys so that you don't lose them. The smaller front accessory cargo pocket is divided into two sections and that's where I keep my wallet and other valuable stuff.The shoulder straps are very well padded and can adjust to any height. I think that they work great when you are carrying one of those heavy loads. The back is also padded so that you don't get poked in the back by any bulky textbooks.Plus, the YKK zippers work very well and the seams have not even begun to split.Because this pack can hold a lot of stuff, it can sometimes make me look like a nerd, but that's okay. I really don't mind that because I get everything organized and because th pack is very comfortable when you carry it.Not only is this pack big, rugged, and holds a lot but it also comes with a lifetime warranty from JanSport which says that if you find anything wrong with your Big Student, you can send it back to them and they will send you a new. Just make sure that you keep the slip that comes with the box.I don't know where I would be without this pack. It's got lots of room, keeps all of your stuff organized so you can find it when you need it, and it holds up well in all kinds of weather because the flaps over the zippers act as rain guards and protect your stuff from getting wet.If you're an organization [person] like me and you need a pack that can hold up in all kinds of weather, then get the Big Student. It will be worth every penny of your money.
Quality wasn't what I thought it would be, it arrived atthe end of the time frame they said it would be,which I was hoping it would be sooner.

I sent this to my Grandson who is 4yrs old and has put it on Every day since recieveing it for his birthday in Sept...He loves it and will wear it tonight..Its perfect for what it was intended for....playing dress up ...B.W.

First off you can buy this cheaper at Walmart! Save yourself some money, because the costume is cheap. The mask is too small. The costume really is not something that is going to last, so if you want it to be more then just Halloween night you might not want to consider this costume. We bought it this morning and the costume already has runs in it.

there was a good and bad side to this item. the good side was that it came faster than i thought it would. the bad side was that it didn't have the same mask as shown in the picture. the mask that was sent w/ it was actually quite crappy. so i just ended up painting my son's face instead.
My nephew is having a blast wearing this - he loves to dress up as a firefighter, Batman, & now Spiderman!  I did think it was overpriced though!!!

I am not happy with this spider man costume. When I ordered it online it showed the full hooded mask for this size. I don't think my child is going to want to wear this beanie cap. He's three years old and he knows the difference.I may have to return this suit. Thanks Cindy Wilkinson
J'ai acheté ce jouet pour mon petit fils.  Je ne peux pas le noter, parce qu'il vit trop loin de moi.
Very bad version of Spiderman Costume for kids.  Unfinished.  I did not like it.  It is like used it. I did not like it.  I will not buy any products like this again.

I ordered this for my son, who was invited to a Superhearo party.  He has been in a solid size 6 and sometimes goes up to a 7.  I think this costume runs a bit small.  It fit him perfectly but if he wore a 7, I think it would be too tight.The costume is of average durability. Parents used to ordering these types of costumes will find it average.  If I had to wash this every week, it might not make it past 6 months.I didn't order any gloves to go with this, he wanted them but didn't need them.  Unless it's a chilly Halloween night, save your $ and skip the gloves as well.Overall my son loves this costume. He's not a fan of the velcroe back. it bothers him, so we leave the back open, he's usually wearing a shirt underneath anyway.We were going to a party in the spring. The costume is quite warm. The material is thin but the overall effect left him overheated in the sun.  Please keep this in mind if you're using the costume in a warmer climate.It is a good value for the price.

Do not like the quality of the product. The eye mask doesn't have big enough holes, nor the right spacing, to allow him to see properly, and he won't allow me to cut bigger holes. I will probably end up painting his face like spiderman. I was disappointed in the costume.

I believe that this halloweenal disguise outfit was very lovely. I felt like the real super-hero named Spider man. The mask fit properly and the actual apparel fit me like a glove. A very tight glove. Although this unsatisfactory size did not captivate my upmost fondness, this disguise was still "5 stars." I cannot wait to show this costume to my friends. They will be very jealous and everyone at my highschool will for that matter! Thank you for creating this amazing high-tech quality Spider man costume!

Yelp, I guarantee this costume will rip on the 1st day of play.  It is really cheaply made.  It's the same cheap costumes that you find in walmart for 7-10 bucks.  And I had to cut out a nose and mouth it doesn't give them a place to breath out of .  YOU GET WHAT YOU PAY FOR so don't pay over 10 bucks for this temporary costume
summary: Guaranteed to Rip on Your 1st day of play

reviewText: My son LOVES Spiderman. I purchased this costume last week. It is nine days later and the costume is falling apart. By the third wear, holes and fraying occurred. I have sewn it back together at least five times. It is horrible. The costume itself is poorly made. It is thin nylon material with a mask that looks nothing like the one in the picture.Do not waste your money, the costume will not last past the first wearing.
it came on time and it fits perfect. the quality of the costume is great. the colors are not faded.

Although my son LOVES this costume and plays with it all the time, I am not happy with it at all.  It is VERY cheaply made.  Within one day of use, the seams started to rip and fray.  The material it is made out of runs easily (like nylons do).  I suppose it's my fault for not reading the reviews more carefully.  If your child will only wear this once, then it is a perfect costume, but if he wants to "live" in it then I would recommend investing in something a little more durable.
this is a great costume. size is true. i ordered it with the matching gloves. great gift for little boys who love spiderman
My daughter loves this costume and wears it almost every day. It seems to be more durable than the costumes in the past.
My 6 year old just loves this costume. It looks just like the one on the movies he said.it was just what he wanted.
He wore the costume twice and it has a hole under the arm and a hole in the crotch.  Very cheaply made
My son loves it, but beware it is cheaply made and very thin. The knees ripped out the first few days we had it.

I can't image what the kids that this doesn't fit properly look like. Unlike other types of old fashioned halloween costumes that  kids might wear street clothes  under, super-heros wear spanex and any  decent looking super-hero custoume will fit skin tight. That's why Superman used to have a pocket in his cape, as his pants were too tight for his wallet. A child we know has  gotten almost two years of wear out of one of these and it is in good enought shape to be passed along to his little brother to wear.And as to the suggestion other folk buy a Spiderman costume from another company, these are LICENSED Costumes. You can only buy them from a company who has purchased the rights to make them.
summary: Super-heros wear spanex you know. costumes SHOULD FIT tightly

reviewText: My kid is hard on toys. That said, this is starting to rip around the chest. That kind of rip that happens in polyester or whatever, where you see little white lines in the fabric. It's not really ripped yet, but it will be soon. Have had it about a week. My son is a size 5 or 6 and I was told by his grandma this runs a little small.
The kids love this and even after Halloween they still love wearing it. We are even able to pass it down to the next child since the fabric is so durable.

We bought this for our 4 year old son for his birthday. He absolutely loves it and wears it often, even to bed. The front is now worn out and snagged. The material is not very durable that's why I rated it 3 stars overall. Nonetheless, if you don't sew,this is a good costume for Halloween or a dress up party, just not something to wear all the time.

This classic spiderman put a big smile in my grandson face...that was enough for me. He is 5 years old now, and I try to promote the idea that we need heores. FOr the time being Spiderman is his favorite, and he is wearing every single day. Love that.

I had bought this costume for my son to wear on Halloween. I tried it on him today to make sure it fit. He ran around in it for over an hour, when I went to take it off of him I noticed tears starting from the collar of the costume and going down to the spider on the chest. My son loves spider man and I hoped he would be able to wear it for pretend play after halloween but I do not think it will last very long.My son just turned 4, he wears a size 5 in boys but I bought this costume in a medium 7-8 since most costumes run small. The legs are a bit long but it fits him well, it is not baggy on him. If I ordered him a smaller size I do not think it would fit. So be aware and order a size bigger for your child especially if they will want to wear it everyday. There is only 2 small nose holes on the mask which I plan to make larger.

My son loved the Spiderman costume and I had to talk him into returning it for a larger size even though it was much too small. The larger size is perfect for him.  And the mask and gloves really make the costume!
summary: Great mask! Had to buy one size up for tall 5 yr old

reviewText: I was disappointed in the costume.  The pisture on the site shows a full mask, but the one I received has just a face mask and a hat- It is deceiving!!!
It was a big hit with my 4 yr. old. He loved it.  It fits perfectly with room for growing.  The price was really good too.

My grandsonn loved the outfit,wore it constantly but the neck and the mask began to run in streaks around the neck and the mask.Probably would be great for occasional use, but he is a fanatic and wears it almost everyday.He loved the eyeholes in the mask.
I just want to recommend them. They are very serious, responsible, and punctual.  I bought a wrong product, and they apologize with me and return all my money.In the future, I will use them.

My son just turned 2 and it fits him perfectly! He is average 2 year old height and weight! It is a little long but bunches up at the feet and fits perfectly! Don't buy for children over 3 unless really small for age!
My son loved it it is good quality is just ok kind of thin but good color mask ripped easy but serve the purpose
Way too fragile for a child's costume. Started falling apart the first day. The fabric is too delicate and shreds like pantyhose. Waste of money. Would not buy again.
summary: started falling apart the first day

reviewText: My 5 year old got this on his birthday so he could be Spidey for a super heroes birthday party once the weekend rolled around. He absolutely could not contain his excitement! He not only wore it for the big day but has wanted to wear it every day since (2 weeks solid). It is a little flimsy and has snags around the neckline now but that only makes it look more webby and crime fighter-esque (in his mind)! He loves it..and, hence, so do I.

I bought this for my son for Halloween.  It was fine for that purpose, but after 2 wearings (for school parade and Halloween night), it was pulling apart at the seams and had a few pulls in the fabric - and my son is not someone who is hard on clothes.  I had only spent $12 on it so it didn't bother me too much, but I would have been upset if I had spent over $15 on it though.  If you are just looking for a cheap Spiderman costume, this will do.
